description: You move yourself to somewhere else.  You cannot move through enemy creatures, and moving through squares that are either difficult terrain or are part of the Threatening Range of an enemy costs twice the movement.  As part of the same Action, you may resolve multiple Athletics Moves, such as walking and then climbing, if you have the available movement squares - you may only choose 1 Mod per turn as normal, however.
name: Athletics

description: You relocate your body by walking, running, swimming or flying.  Travelling through multiple squares of a Threatening Range of an enemy costs twice the movement for each square beyond the first. If you relocate under stress for a number of minutes greater than your CON bonus, you need to succeed at the Relocate Move every minute at an incrementing DC, or need to stop and gain the Exhausted Status.
name: Relocate

description: You perform a jump, moving up to a number of squares horizontally equal to 1/2 your movement or vertically equal to 1/4 of your movement, however you must succeed at a Relocate Move Roll with the DC equal to the number of squares you are jumping.  The DC reduces by 1 if you get a run-up.
name: Jump

description: You climb a surface a number of squares equal to half your movement speed, however you must succeed at a Relocate Move Roll with the DC equal to the difficulty of the surface.
name: Climb

description: You safely fall a number of squares equal to 2 plus twice your CON bonus, however you must succeed at a Relocate Move Roll with the DC equal to the number of squares you fall.  If you fail, you lose 3 Verve per square you fell, and may incur a negative Status.
name: Fall

description: Until the beginning of your next turn, ignore the Encumbered Status.  When used outside of Combat, resolve the Relocate Move against a DC of 2 to gain this benefit for 1 minute.
name: Heavy Armour Relocate

description: You may split the movement of your Relocate Move(s) into multiple parts, resolving Relocate, Jump, Climb and Fall before, after or during your other Moves.
name: Split Relocate

description: Your movement this turn is reduced to 0sq.  Next turn, you gain 3sq. movement.
name: Stored Potential

description: If you have less than 10% of your HP remaining and are in combat, your Move increases by 2sq.
name: Adrenal Relocate

description: You may resolve the Relocate Move through squares occupied by an enemy figure, however you lose 1 Verve for each creature whose Threatening Range is on one of the squares you move through.  Verve Loss cannot be ignored by Resistances.
name: Slip Through I

description: You may Relocate through enemy squares without penalty.
name: Slip Through II

description: If a creature moves within 1 square of you and is not fleeing from you, you gain 2sq of movement on your turn.  You gain this benefit once per turn.
name: Slipstream

description: You gain a +2 Bonus to the Relocate Move when negotiating unstable ground.  Additionally, any movement penalty applied by difficult terrain this turn is halved.
name: Stable Relocater

description: If you move at least 4 squares, you slide as part of your movement and gain +3 UDR against Basic and Special Ranged attacks this turn, unless your Armour's UDR is higher.
name: Slide

description: You attempt leap over a creature and apply the Blind Status to them (Blind applying only when they target you).  You are successful if you succeed at resolving the Jump Move at a DC equal to the size category of the creature you face: DC1 for tiny, DC2 for small, or DC3 for normal.  This effect wears off if you attack them or take an obvious Action, and they gain the Cautious Status.
name: Hopscotch

description: Resolve the Jump Move, adding 1sq. of vertical, 2sq. of horizontal, or Resolve the Fall Move adding 4sq. of falling distance.
name: Acrobatic Leaper I

description: Resolve the Jump Move, adding 2sq. of vertical, 3sq. of horizontal, or Resolve the Fall Move adding 6sq. of falling distance.
name: Acrobatic Leaper II

description: Resolve the Fall Move.  If you succeed, you add 6sq. of falling distance.  When you land, you also roll out of your fall, travelling up to 4 free sq.  Rolling in this way can be considered a direct line, for the purposes of other Mods and Moves.
name: Tuck and Roll

description: You can climb your full movement.
name: Shimmy

description: You jump off a wall or a creature at least 1 size category larger than you, gaining an additional 3sq of height.  You may optionally end your turn on your target, it if it was a creature.
name: Kick Leap

description: Resolve the Jump Move as if you had a run-up.
name: Standing Leap

description: Instead of resolving an Athletics Move, you reduce your movement speed to 0.  Until the start of your next turn, you gain +2 to Defence Rolls against effects that try to move you, including Trip and Grapple, and additionally Disarm.  Additionally, your opponent gets no bonus damage or effects for charging.  Finally, if an enemy attempts to move around you or through you, resolve the Athletics Move.  If you beat their Dexterity, you prevent them from taking that movement, and they must choose a different path.
name: Root

description: If you have a clear downward path of at least 4sq to a target and succeed at an Athletics Move, you leap down and deal them your Bonus Damage Dice.  Place yourself on an adjacent unoccupied sq.  Alternatively, if they have a larger size category than you, you may land on top of them.
name: Downward Strike

description: If you were hit last turn, you gain +1 sq of movement this turn
name: Painful Retreat

description: If you used the Relocate Move this turn, the first creature that uses their Basic Reposition within twice your Threatened Area has their movement reduced by 2sq.  They may ignore this, and if they do you deal your Bonus Damage to them.
name: Tactical Position

description: Resolve the Jump Move.  If you leap onto and off a wall as part of your movement, you are not disdvantaged for moving through squares that are within enemy Threatening Ranges, and you gain +2sq. of horizontal distance.
name: Wall Leap

description: Resolve the Jump Move.  On a Raw Roll of 18+, 1 target whose Threatening Range you leaped through is considered Flanked for other Moves you make on it this turn.
name: Wall Flanker

description: Resolve the Jump Move to jump at least 3sq. into your Threatening Range of a creature.  If you succeed, you upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice until the start of your next turn.
name: Leap Attack

description: Resolve the Jump Move to jump at least 3sq. into your Threatening Range of a creature.  Your Jump Move automatically succeds, and you apply an additional 5 Verve Loss when resolving Basic Melee Attack.  On a Raw Roll of 11+ you also deal twice your Bonus Damage to them.  On a Raw Roll of 18+ you also knock adjacent Medium or smaller creatures prone.
name: Slam

description: When prone, you leap to your feet and enemies lose their PRed against you.  You are also considered hidden to them for the purposes of the first Basic Attack you make on them this round, even if they are Cautious.
name: To your feet

description: If your target is Flanked, resolve the Jump Move at a DC of 2, or 1 if your target is 2 size categories larger than you.  If you succeed, you jump off them and backward 3sq, and deal them 15 Physical Damage.
name: Blind Spot: Kick off

description: Instead of sacrificing your Primary Action for a second unmodded Relocate Move, you sacrifice it for a modded Relocate Move.
name: Dashing Relocate I

description: You gain a second Relocate Move, in addition to your Primary and original Relocate Moves.
name: Dashing Relocate II

description: You may use 2 Mods on all Athletics Moves this turn if you pay the Stamina cost.
name: Brutal Relocate

description: Once per combat, you may increase your movement speed by 2sq for one turn, or use an additional Mod with the Athletics Moves.
name: Athletics Mastery

description: You rest, restoring your body and mind.  A Rest Cycle is 30 minutes, and you may gain the benefit of 1 16-Cycle Long Rest and 4 Cycles of Short and Medium Rest per day.  If you do not resolve the Long Rest Move, or you do not eat, once per day, you gain the Exhausted Status until you do.
name: Rest

description: In combat you take a moment, regaining 5 Verve, plus your CON Bonus, plus your points in the Rest Skill.  You may use this once per Combat.
name: Take a Breather

description: When in a comfortable space, you take Rest for 10 minutes which counts as 1 Rest Cycle.  If you are below your Verve Reserve, you Restore up to that value.  You additionally restore 10 Mana, plus 1 per point in the Rest Skill.
name: Short Rest

description: When in a comfortable space, you take Rest for 2 Rest Cycles.  If you are below twice your Verve Reserve, you Restore up to that value.  You additionally restore 25% of your total Mana, plus 2 per point in the Rest Skill.  Finally, you also Restore 1 Stamina.
name: Medium Rest

description: When in a comfortable space, you Rest or Sleep for 16 Cycles, restoring all your Mana, Psi, Verve and Stamina.
name: Long Rest

description: When you have the Dying Status, you may attempt to stabilise and remove it.  You stabilise if you successfully resolve the Rest Move Roll at a DC2.  If your current Verve is less than -10 or you have a Wound Status, the DC raises to 3.  After Stabilising, you awaken with the Prone and Wound: Injured Statuses.
name: Stabilise

description: When performing a Long Rest, you remove one of the following Long Statuses: Dazed, Discordant, Dumb, Exhausted, Limited, Staggered, Terrified, Vulnerable, Weakened.  Additionally, you grant a +2 bonus to anyone tending to you to treat a Wounded Status.
name: Recouperative Sleeper

description: Resolve a Long Rest.  You restore only 80% of your Verve, however you Gain 1 additional Stamina which, if unused, is lost the next time you resolve Long Rest.
name: Energising Rest

description: Resolve a Long Rest.  You gain 1 Lucky.  As a Free Action, you may expend Lucky to reroll any roll.  You must accept the new result if you do.  Lucky expires the next time you resolve Long Rest.
name: Lucky

description: Resolve Take a Breather.  You may additionally gain any number of Long Debilities of your choice.  If you do, gain +20 Verve for each.
name: Desperate Breather

description: Using Rapid Rest also grants you a +1 Bonus to your next Move Roll.
name: Reflective Breather

description: Resolve Take a Breather and roll a d20.  On a Raw Roll of 11+, you Gain 10 Verve instead of the normal 5.
name: Rapid Breather

description: Resolve Take a Breather.  You gain 1 Brutal.  As a Free Action, you may exchange 1 Brutal to upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice for 1 round.  You may hold only 1 Brutal at any time.
name: Damage Preparation

description: If you have at least one adjacent target, and all are Flanked and do not have the Cautious Status, Resolving Rest as Take a Breather is a Quick Action.
name: Blind Spot: Preparation

description: If you killed a creature this turn, you may resolve the Rapid Rest Move as a Quick Action.
name: Kill Catalyst

description: Using the Take a Breather Move restores 15% of your HP if you have less than 15% of your health remaining.  This does not count as a use of Take a Breather.
name: Second Wind

description: Resolve the Take a Breather Move.  One other Move you use this turn can be used with an additional Mod, to a maximum of 2 Mods.
name: Quick Preparation

description: Resolve the Take a Breather Move.  You delay the effect of a poison, a disease, or a spell which affects your mind this turn.
name: Delay Affliction

description: Your Verve Reserve is 10% larger.
name: Quickened Rest

description: You Stabilise automatically and with all your Moves available, if you can pay the Stamina cost.
name: Stabiliser

description: When resolving the Long Rest Move, you may choose 2 Mods
name: Sleep Afficionado

description: Any time you Restore Verve, you Restore 1 additional Veve.
name: Quick Healer

description: Any time you Restore Verve, you may treat it as Gaining Verve, however your Temporary Verve may not exceed 25.
name: Healthy Constitution

description: You are used to long awake times.  You only need to resolve the Long Rest Move or eat once every 3 days to avoid Exhaustion.  You may use this ability once, and it is restored when you perform a Long Rest and eat a meal.
name: Extended Wakefulness

description: When under the effect of the Flowing Status, you Restore an additional 2 Verve.
name: Does the body good

description:
You use items at hand.  Some items require resolving another Move, which you resolve at the time of using the item.

You typically have room on Accessory Belt / Item Belt for 2 limited-use items, or 5 Alchemical Reagents, per point int Use Item without fear of breakage.  You may additionally hold 3 small throwable weapons, such as knives or shuriken, plus 1 per point in Use Item.
name: Use Item

description: You drink an alchemical or potion that is in your accessory belt, or you apply one to an adjacent willing target.  If you are the target, this move is resolved as a Quick Action.
name: Quaff

description: You trigger the effects of a usable item that is in your accessory belt, such as a Runic Seal, and which you have the ability to use on yourself or a valid target.  If the item requires you to Resolve a Move, resolve it now.
name: Use

description: You apply an oil or poison that is on your accessory belt to a weapon that you have equipped.
name: Apply Weapon Oil

description: You restock your accessory belt / container with up to 3 items, or you stop to Rummage in your pack for up to 2 items that you know are there.
name: Rummage / Restock

description: Resolve the Quaff or Use Move with a potion, Alchemical, or simple item as a Quick Action.
name: Quick Quaffer

description: Resolve the Use Move against a Flanked target.  Any damage applied by the item is increased by 4.
name: Blind Spot: Use Item

description: When outside of all enemy Threatening Ranges, you resolve the Apply Weapon Oil Move as a Quick Action.
name: Apply Weapon Oil

description: If you throw a bomb or item that produces an explosion or shrapnel into a combat with at least 8 participants connected, the range of the item becomes the spaces occupied by all creatures in the connection.
name: Carpet Bomb

description: When resolving the Rummage / Restock Move, you retrieve any number of items that you can safely handle.
name: Reckless Rummager

description: When resolving the Use Move with an item that has or had multiple charges, you do not expend the charge on a Raw Roll of 17+
name: Economical User

description: You may resolve the Quaff Move with a willing target within 10sq. (other than yourself) as the target.
name: Hold in one.

description: You may resolve the Use Move with an item that has charges, or with up to 3 Alchemical Bombs.  When you do, you expend up to 3 charges on the item or hurl up to 3 bombs as a single action against the same target.  Any item with charges is completely expended.
name: Tick, tick, boom

description: When resolving the Quaff Move with a potion, it gains +1 to one of its effects.
name: Frequent Quaffer

description: When outside of all enemy Threatening Ranges, you resolve the Quaff Move as a Free Action.  You may only use this once per turn.
name: Free Quaffer

description: When resolving the Quaff Move with an Alchemical, it gains +1 to one of its effects.
name: Frequent Snuffer

description: Your item belt holds two more items safely.
name: Utility Bandolier

description: You resist certain Moves using your armour and ability to block.
name: Block

description:
You resist basic attacks by taking them on your armour, plus your resist Moves that target STR for their defences.  To block, you need to be wearing Armour, wielding a one-handed melee weapon or carrying a shield.  If you succeed, you reduce the incoming Verve Damage by 50% and your attacker incurs 1 Verve Loss.  Additionally, on a Raw Roll of 20 you reduce the incoming Verve loss to 0.

The maximum number of points you can spend on Block each time you resolve it is equal to your Maximum Block value, which is a combination of your armour, your weapon and shield, and bonuses from magic and Move Mods.
name: Block (STR)

description: If you resolved Basic Melee Attack this turn, you gain +1 to your Move Roll.  If you did not use a Mod with Basic Melee Attack, you instead gain +2.
name: Careful Fighter

description: If you applied at least 10 Verve Loss to your opponent on your turn, you gain +1 to your Move Roll.
name: Parry

description: You incur a -2 penalty to the Block Move.  If you use the Melee Attack Move on next turn, apply your Bonus Damage Dice as damage to them.
name: Turned weapons

description: You deal 2 Verve Loss to targets you succeed against, and 1 to those you do not.
name: Riposte

description: You resolve Block with a -3 penalty to your Move Roll, however you deal 4 Verve Loss to targets you succeed against, and 3 to those you do not.
name: Thorn Block

description: On a successful Block, you gain a +1 Bonus to Influence Moves against your target until the end of your next turn.
name: Defiant Block

description: Instead of being a Reaction Move, you can use Block as your Relocate Move.  You gain UDR equal to half your Skill Points in the Block Move.
name: Hunker Down

description: You gain a +2 bonus to the Block Move against non-magical Basic and Special attacks that try to move or stun you.
name: Root

description: If you are weilding a Shield and relocated towards your target at least 3sq. this turn, you gain +2 to the Block Move against that opponent until the start of your next turn.
name: Shielded Advance

description: For the rest of the turn, you ignore any number of Basic Attacks equal to your Armour or Shield's PDR.  This effect may also apply to Special Attacks if the Armour or Shield you sacrificed is magical.  The Armour or Shield you sacrificed has its PDR reduced to 0, which can be alleviated with simple repairs.
name: Last Defense

description: When the target of a Basic Attack and you are behind an ally that is using Block against your target, you may use the Block Skill value of your ally instead of your own.  Similarly, you may apply your Block to an ally behind you if you are the one in front.
name: Blocking Slipstream

description: If you are against or behind a wall or in a defensible space, you may attempt a Block against area of effect spells and effects, even if they do not normally allow them.  If the effect does not have a successful Block effect, you gain 3 UDR against it.
name: Wall Huddle

description: You trigger a personal World Changer if you Block with a Raw Roll of 20+.  Your 20 can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Block

description: If your target does not have the Cautious Status, then instead of resolving the Block Move you may willingly split damage between the original target and yourself at a rate of 75% to you and 25% to your opponent.  However you may only use this on targets adjacent to you and damage applied to you cannot be resisted.
name: Absorb Block

description: When using Block to defend against a Special Attack that allows it, and you are adjacent to an ally, you may reroll a failure.  You can use this once per combat.
name: Special Shield

description: You move to and redirect all Basic, Magic and Special Attacks from an ally who is adjacent, or within your remaining sq of movement.  Special Attacks with Areas of Effect only affect you once.
name: Human Shield

description: You gain twice your armour's PDR as a bonus to each Move Roll for the Block Move, and you have no Maximum Block this turn.
name: Grand Block

description: As a Free Action, you may reduce your Maximum Block until the start of your next turn.  For each point you sacrifice, an adjacent ally gains 1 UDR until the start of their turn.
name: Block Other

description: Once per combat, you may reroll a failed Block with a -2 penalty.
name: Seasoned Blocker

description: As a Free Action, until the start of your next turn you may ignore all PDR applied from your Armour and Weapons to gain a +1 to the Block Move.
name: Great Block

description: You may spend a Stamina to ignore the effects of the Weakened Status Effect for 2 Turns, or instead to ignore the effect of Staggered for 1 turn.
name: STR Resistant

description: You resist certain Moves using your ability to avoid them.
name: Dodge

description:
You resist Basic Attacks by avoiding them, plus you resist Moves that target DEX for their defences.  To Dodge, you must not be Encumbered or Rooted, and you must be aware of your attacker.  If you succeed, you reduce the incoming Verve Damage by 50% and you can move to an adjacent unoccupied square as a Free Action after all enemies have resolved their turns.  Additionally, on a Raw Roll of 20 you reduce the incoming Verve loss to 0.

The maximum number of points you can spend on Dodge each time you resolve it is equal to your Maximum Dodge value, which is a combination of your armour and bonuses from magic and Move Mods.
name: Dodge (DEX)

description: If you have your full movement left this turn, you gain +1 to your Dodge Move Roll.
name: Ready Dodge

description: If you have not used your Relocate Action, you gain +2 to the Dodge Move.
name: Poised Dodge

description: You gain +1 to the Dodge Move against Ranged Basic Attacks that originated at least 12sq away from you.
name: Ranged Dodge

description: If you successfully Dodge, you may move up to 2sq instead of 1 and you may move through your opponents freely.
name: Repositioning Dodge

description: You gain +1 to your Dodge Move Roll if you are next to a solid structure, like a pillar or brazier, and there is an unoccupied space available for you to leap to.  You must move to that space on a success.
name: Environmental Dodge

description: If you've moved directly away at least 4qs. from a target this turn, you gain +2 to the Dodge Move against Basic and Special Attacks it uses against you.
name: Retreater

description: On a Raw Roll of 11+, if you succeed at your Dodge you deal your Bonus Damage Dice (if you have a weapon with the Throwable Tag in your Item Belt), or may cast a Cantrip (but must pay a minimum Mana cost of 1, if it is lower), at your target.
name: Throw and Dodge

description: If you successfully Dodge, you gain +1 to the following Moves against this creature on your next turn: Stealth, Subterfuge, Ki Attunement, Kinetics, Use Item.
name: Dodge Reaction

description: You get +4 to all Dodges you use this turn.
name: Grand Dodge

description: When resolving the Dodge Move, you may roll up to 4sq.  If that would avoid a Special Attacks's area of effect, you automatically succeed at your Dodge Roll against that Special Attack.
name: Rolly-polly

description: If you participate in a combat with at least 6 participants connected, you gain +2 to the Dodge Move.
name: Throng Dodge

description: Instead of being a Reaction Move, you can use Dodge as your Relocate Move.  Resolve it immediately and apply it to the first Basic or Special Attack against you, even if the Special Attack does not normally allow a Dodge.  You may reroll this resolve once, and you may still use the Dodge Move as a Reaction to subsequent attacks that target you.
name: Preemptive Dodge

description: You trigger a Personal World Changer if you achieve a Raw Roll of 20+.  Your Roll can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Dodge

description: Whenever you resolve the Dodge Move against a target: you have Noted them.  Any time a target that you have Noted leaves your Threatening Range, you may resolve the Jump Move with a DC of 2 as a Free Action, to leap to within Threatened Area of your target, or up to your maximum Jump distance, towards the attacker you Dodged.  When you land, if your target is in your Threatening Range, then your next attack adds your Bonus Damage Dice.
name: Lunging Dodge

description: You push an ally who is within 2 squares of you and is the target of a Basic Attack into a safe space up to 2 sq away from where they began.  Your ally is now the target only of the first basic attack, and you are the target of all subsequent ones that they would have incurred.
name: Dodge Push

description: Once per combat, when may reroll a failed Dodge with a -2 penalty.
name: Seasoned Dodger

description: When under the effect of the Bound Status, you do not incur the -2 penalty to Move Rolls on Primary Moves.  When under the effects of the Prone Status, attacks do not deal extra Damage to you.
name: DEX Resistant

description: You resist Moves that target CON for their defences
name: Resist CON

description: You resist Moves that target CON for their defences
name: Resist (CON)

description: Once per Long Rest, you gain a +1 bonus to Resist (CON).
name: Rested Constitution

description: When using the Resist (CON) move, you gain a +1 bonus against poisons.  If you fail, you reduce the effect of the posion by 25%.
name: Healthy

description: When using the Resist (CON) move, you gain a +1 bonus against diseases.  If you fail, you reduce the effect of the disease by 25% for 1 day.
name: Wellness

description: If you have failed a Resist (CON) in the last hour, you gain a +1 Bonus to your Resist (CON) Move Roll.  This increases to +2 the second and subsequent times in the hour.
name: Adaptive Resist (CON)

description: You trigger a Personal World Changer if you achieve a Raw Roll of 19+. If you rolled a 20, your Roll can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Resist (CON)

description: When under the effect of the Stunned Status Effect, you may choose to ignore either losing an action, or performing Moves that require a Move Roll.  When under the effect of the Confused Status Effect, you are confused on a Raw Roll of 10+ instead of 7+.
name: CON Resistant

description: If you fail your Resist (CON), you can halve its duration.
name: Shrug Resist (CON)

description: You resist Moves that target INT for their defences
name: Resist INT

description: You resist Moves that target INT for their defences
name: Resist

description: Once per Long Rest, you gain a +1 bonus to Resist (INT).
name: Rested Intelligence

description: When using the Resist (INT) move, you gain a +1 bonus against stunning effects.  If you fail, you delay the effect for 1 Round.
name: Healthy

description: When using the Resist (INT) move, you gain a +1 bonus against confusion and effects that make you more dim-witted.  If you fail, you delay the effect for 1 Round.
name: Wellness

description: If you have failed a Resist (INT) in the last hour, you gain a +1 Bonus to your Resist (INT) Move Roll.  This increases to +2 the second and subsequent times in the hour.
name: Adaptive Resist (INT)

description: You trigger a Personal World Changer if you achieve a Raw Roll of 19+. If you rolled a 20, your Roll can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Resist (INT)

description: You may spend a Stamina as a Free Action to ignore the effects of Dumb for 1 Turn.  When under the effects of the Dazed Status, you may maintain concentration for 2 Rounds instead of 1.
name: INT Resistant

description: If you fail your Resist (INT), you can halve its duration.
name: Shrug Resist (INT)

description: You resist Moves that target WIS for their defences
name: Resist WIS

description: You resist Moves that target WIS for their defences
name: Resist (INT)

description: Once per Long Rest, you gain a +1 bonus to Resist (WIS).
name: Rested Wisdom

description: When using the Resist (WIS) move, you gain a +1 bonus against effects that teleport you.
name: Healthy

description: When using the Resist (WIS) move, you gain a +1 bonus against effects that curse you and effects that attempt to disrupt your concentration.
name: Wellness

description: If you have failed a Resist (WIS) in the last hour, you gain a +1 Bonus to your Resist (WIS) Move Roll.  This increases to +2 the second and subsequent times in the hour.
name: Adaptive Resist (WIS)

description: You trigger a Personal World Changer if you achieve a Raw Roll of 19+. If you rolled a 20, your Roll can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Resist (WIS)

description: When under the effects of the Frightened Status Effect, your penatly is reduced to -1.  You may ignore a single reroll that is triggered by the Cursed Status Effect, applicable to each unique Cursed Effect.
name: WIS Resistant

description: If you fail your Resist (WIS), you can halve its duration.
name: Shrug Resist (WIS)

description: You resist Moves that target CHA for their defences
name: Resist CHA

description: You resist Moves that target CHA for their defences
name: Resist

description: Once per Long Rest, you gain a +1 bonus to Resist (CHA).
name: Rested Charisma

description: When using the Resist (CHA) move, you gain a +1 bonus against effects that teleport you.
name: Healthy

description: When using the Resist (CHA) move, you gain a +1 bonus against effects that curse you.
name: Wellness

description: If you have failed a Resist (CHA) in the last hour, you gain a +1 Bonus to your Resist (CHA) Move Roll.  This increases to +2 the second and subsequent times in the hour.
name: Adaptive Resist (CHA)

description: You trigger a Personal World Changer if you achieve a Raw Roll of 19+. If you rolled a 20, your Roll can still apply to a second World Changer.
name: Gambling Resist (CHA)

description: You may ignore the effects of the Charmed Status Effect for 1 turn, applicable to each individual Charm Effect.  During that turn you do not gain any additional awareness that you have been Charmed.  When under the effect of the Limited Status Effect, your maximum Points you can access is 6.
name: CHA Resistant

description: If you fail your Resist (CHA), you can halve its duration.
name: Shrug Resist (CHA)

description: You attack with a melee weapon or your body.
name: Melee Attack

description:
You harry your opponents, wearing them down as you slice and dice with your melee weapon or fists.  Unless one of your opponent has a Special Defence, your attacks automatically hit.  To resolve your Damage, roll a D20 and your Weapon Damage Dice.  If you roll a critical failure, you apply no Verve Loss.  If you roll a success, you add your Weapon Damage Dice value to your Melee Attack Skill.  If you roll a critical success, you roll your Weapon Damage Dice again, and any Verve Loss applied ignores PRes.  You apply Verve Loss to 1 target within your Threatening Range.

Any attack made while riding halves your applicable Verve Loss and applies a -2 Penalty to your Defenses Moves.
name: Basic Melee Attack

description: You attempt to capture an opponent with your body if you succeed at a Grapple Move Roll against the target's STR.  For each size category larger than you, you incur a -4 penalty.  If you succeed, you gain the Encumbered Status and opponent gains the Grappled Status.
name: Grapple

description: You attempt to trip an opponent with your weapon or body, if you succeed at a Trip Move Roll against the target's DEX.  For each size category larger than you, you incur a -4 penalty, and you cannot Trip creatures with 4 or more legs.  If you succeed, regular opponents gains the Prone Status, while larger or monstrous creatures will earn a Stagger.
name: Trip

description: You attempt to disarm an opponent's weapon, shield, or held item with your weapon or body, if you succeed at a Disarm Move Roll against the target's STR or DEX, whichever is higher.  For each size category larger than you, you incur a -4 penalty.  If you succeed, your opponent drops their item on the ground.
name: Disarm

description: Resolve Basic Melee Attack with a ranged or throwable weapon.
name: Ranged Symbiosis

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you may apply your calculated Verve Loss to up to 3 targets.
name: Attack Expertise I

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you may apply your calculated Verve Loss, with a +10 Bonus, to up to 5 targets
name: Attack Expertise II

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, on a Raw Roll of 11+ you apply an additional 3 Verve Loss.  You may roll this again, increasing the Raw Roll requirement by 1, adding an additional 3 Verve each time you succeed, as many times until you fail.
name: Whirlwind Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, critical Hits this turn are achieved on a Raw Roll of 16+.
name: Critical Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you may sacrifice any number of Dodge and Block points, whichever is higher for you, to apply 1 additional Verve Loss per point sacrificed.
name: Rapid Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, add twice the maximum value of your Bonus Damage Dice as Verve Loss.
name: Furious Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, you add your Bonus Damage Dice three times to your total applied Verve Loss.  DEPRECATED DUE TO REPETITION OF FURIOUS ATTACK
name: Steady Attack (DEPRECATED)

description: Instead of resolving Basic Melee Attack, you use your full Combat to bash your shield, dealing 1 Stagger to all opponents adjacent to you.  This also occurs as a Free Action if an ally uses their Primary Move to make a Ranged Basic Attack against you, and you do not take any damage for that Attack.
name: Shield Clang

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you ran exclusively in a straight line at least 4sq to your opponent this turn, take the maximum value of your Weapon Damage Dice instead of rolling it.  If you ran exactly 4 squares, you additionally apply 2 more Verve Loss.
name: Charged Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you apply the Stagger Status to a creature if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 17+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 20+ for DC 4 creatures.
name: Staggering Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you nullify its Special Defences if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 15+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 18+ for DC 4.  DC 5 and higher creatures cannot have their Defences nullified.
name: Defence Nullifying Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you remove 1 points from its Charge Meter (or 2 on a Critical Hit), which it uses to power Special Attacks, if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 17+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 20+ for DC 4.
name: Exhausting Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you may reduce the movement speed of that creature by 2sq until your next turn.  On a Raw Roll of 19+, this lasts indefinitely.
name: Hobbling Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you may reduce the damage of a creature by 3 until your next turn.  On a Raw Roll of 19+, this lasts indefinitely.
name: Sundering Attack

description: Deal your Bonus Damage Dice to a target that you are Flanking.
name: Quick Jab

description: When you resolve this Move, gain 1 Opportunistic.  If a target leaves your Threatened Area, remove an Opportunisitc and deal your Bonus Damage Dice to it.
name: Opportunity Attack I

description: When you resolve this Move, gain 1 Opportunistic.  If a target enters or leaves your Threatened Area, remove an Opportunisitc and deal your Bonus Damage Dice to it.
name: Opportunity Attack II

description: You deal your Bonus Damage Dice to an opponent, at the cost of 2 Verve Loss to yourself per rank of Damage Dice that you currently have.
name: Push the attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if one of your targets is Flanked, you apply 2 additional Verve Loss to them.
name: Blind Spot: Cheap Shot

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you halve your applicable Verve Loss, but you ignore URes and PRes against the targets of your Basic Melee Attack this turn.
name: Piercing Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you achieve a Raw Roll of 18+, you disrupt a magical effect that requires concentration for your target.  If your target is casting a spell that takes more than 1 round, you also disrupt the cast.
name: Blow to the head

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you apply Unified to alll allies who are attacking your target, which expires at the start of your next turn.  Unified allies apply +2 Verve Loss on their Basic Melee Attacks.
name: Unified Attack

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you apply 3 additional Verve Loss if there is at least one target who is beneath you.
name: Vertical Strike

description: After Resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, you can move an adjacent opponent of the same size category or smaller 1 Square, and yourself in the same direction, if the new squares are not dangerous to you or your target.
name: Control

description: After resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, you can switch the positions of yourself and all adjacent enemies of your size or smaller.
name: Battlefield Control

description: Instead of resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, you push an object up to your STR in sq away from you, or you dislodge it, if you can beat the DC of the item's weight class on a STR Check.  Violently pushed objects that strike targets apply Verve Loss equal to the object's weight class, and may trigger a trip attempt.  Alterantively, you shove a creature that does not have the Cautious Status up to your STR in sq away from you, if you can beat the DC of the creature's weight class.  For each size category they are larger than you, reduce the sq by 1.  If your target hits a hard surface or another target, you apply your normal Verve Loss, plus your STR bonus and your Bonus Damage Dice.  If they hit another target, that target takes half that damage.  All targets affected gain the Cautious Status.
name: Push

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, if you sacrifice 5 applicable Verve Loss on your attack, you grant an adjacent ally a +1 Bonus to the Dodge or Block Moves until the start of your next turn.
name: Defender

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack, you ignore counter attacks, including emitted fluids or energies, that you would normally incur.
name: Careful Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, if your target is unaware of you or is Flanked, does not have the Cautious Status, and your weapon that has the Backstab Tag, then you perform a Sneak Attack.  You deal your normal Verve Loss and roll your Bonus Damage Dice two times, adding the results.  Additionally, you may upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice for this turn 1 rank for each Cloak you sacrifice.  After resolving this, you lose the Stealth Status and your target gains the Cautious Status.
name: Sneak Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, if your target is unaware of you or is Flanked, does not have the Cautious Status, and your weapon that has the Backstab Tag, then you perform a Sneak Attack.  You deal your normal Verve Loss and roll your Bonus Damage Dice three times, adding the results.  Additionally, you may upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice for this turn 1 rank for each Cloak you sacrifice.  After resolving this, you lose the Stealth Status and your target gains the Cautious Status.
name: Furious Sneak Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, your attack automatically criticals, and you take the maximum value of all rolls.
name: Weakpoint Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Melee Attack Move, if you score a Raw Roll of 15+ you generate a Mana, Psi, Ki or a Rage.
name: Flow Attack

description: When resolving the Grapple Move, you may also attempt the Subterfuge Move against your target.
name: Grapple Sneak

description: When resolving the Grapple Move, you gain 3 UDR against that creatures attacks against you until the start of your next turn.
name: Grapple Defense

description: When resolving the Trip Move, you may attempt to trip a creature of any number of legs, and the penalty for each size category larger than you is reduced to -2.
name: Trip Monster

description: When resolving the Trip Move, if you successfully trip your opponent you apply Verve Loss equal to your Bonus Damage Dice to them.
name: Trip Combo

description: When resolving the Trip Move, if you ran exclusively in a straight line at least 4sq to your opponent this turn, your Trip Move Roll gains a +1 Bonus.  You also get this bonus if you have the low ground or are Prone, and can reach your target's feet.
name: Trip Position

description: When resolving the Disarm Move, if you are successful you gain a +2 bonus to Intimidate until the end of your next turn.
name: Disarm Intimidater

description: When resolving the Disarm Move, if you are successful and you achieved a Raw Roll of 14+, you also kick the weapon or item 4sq. away.
name: Disarm Kick

description: When resolving the Trip, Disarm or Grapple Moves, you gain a +1 bonus to your Move Roll if you Blocked them successfully last turn.
name: Riposte Maneuvre

description: After resolving a Basic Melee Attack, choose 1 target you applied Verve Loss to.  On their turn that creature receives your Bonus Damage Dice if they use their Relocate Move.  Your target is aware of their affliction.
name: Pressure Point

description: All attacks made with your weapon are non-mortal, even if the weapon does not normally support it
name: Non-mortal Attack

description: Whenever you kill an opponent, you immediately apply 3 Verve Loss to an opponent in your Threatening Range that you have not applied Verve Loss to, or 2 to one you have.
name: Frenzier

description: Twice per combat, you may reroll all Damage Dice you rolled.  You may expend this ability on the same Roll twice, if you wish.
name: Seasoned Attack

description: When you kill an opponent, you improve your Bonus Damage Dice by 1 Rank until the end of your next turn.
name: Inspired Attack

description: Your Bonus Damage Dice improves by 1 rank.
name: Biting Melee Attack

description: When a target of your attacks is adjacent to something in the environment, such as a torch on the wall or a cluttered shelf, you may use your attacks to guide them towards it.  After resolving an attack, declare that you wish to guide your target towards something adjacent to them in the environment.  They do not move a square, but you may gain an advantage for the environment, such as setting them on fire or pushing them into sharp objects.
name: Collateral Damage

description: You may choose an additional Mod when resolving Attack.
name: Enforced Attack

description: You attack with a ranged weapon or your body.
name: Ranged Attack

description:
You harry your opponents, wearing them down as you pepper and fire at them with your ranged or throwable weapon.  Unless one of your opponent has a Special Defence, your attacks automatically hit.  To resolve your Damage, roll a D20 and your Weapon Damage Dice.  If you roll a critical failure, you apply no Verve Loss.  If you roll a success, you add your Weapon Damage Dice value to your Melee Attack Skill.  If you roll a critical success, you roll your Weapon Damage Dice again.

You split your applied Verve Loss against any number of targets within your Threatening Range.
name: Basic Ranged Attack

description: Resolve Basic Ranged Attack against an adjacent target with a melee weapon or your fists.
name: Melee Symbiosis

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, you apply an additional 3 Verve Loss if you target 3 or more creatures.
name: Multishot

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, you may apply your calculated Verve Loss, with a +10 Bonus, to up to 5 targets
name: Ranger Shot

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, you apply 1 Verve Loss to all targets you have a clear shot to.
name: Rapid Fire I

description: You deal the maximum value of your Ranged Weapon Damage + Bonus Weapon Damage, striking as many opponents as you wish and dividing your damage amongst them.  All attacks are considered Striking Ranged Attacks
name: Rapid Fire II

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, critical Hits this turn are achieved on a Raw Roll of 17+.
name: Critical Shot

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, you may sacrifice all your Dodge and Block points for 3 additional Verve Loss.
name: Dangerous Shot

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, add twice the maximum value of your Bonus Damage Dice to your Verve Loss.
name: Brutal Shot

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack which deals only your Weapon Damage.
name: Quick Shot

description: You deal your Bonus Damage Dice to an opponent with your Ranged Weapon, at the cost of 2 Verve Loss to yourself per rank of Damage Dice that you currently have.
name: Push the attack

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack against a target that is exactly 3 squares away from you at the start of your turn.  You gain +4 to the applied Verve Loss.  You may only use this ability twice per target.
name: Midrange Slinger

description: When resolving the Basic Ranged Attack Move, on a Raw Roll of 15+ you add your Bonus Damage Dice.
name: Called Shot

description: When resolving the Basic Ranged Attack Move, if you successfully dodged your target on their last turn, you apply additional Verve Loss to then equal to your Bonus Damage.
name: Dodge shot

description: When resolving the Basic Ranged Attack Move, if you have less than 5% of your health remaining, you add your Bonus Damage Dice to you applicable Verve Loss.
name: Adrenal Shot

description: Instead of resolving a Basic Ranged Attack, you wait for the opportunity to strike.  On your next turn, your attack applies 5 additional Verve Loss and pierces 5 PRes.  If you wait an additional turn, this increases to 10 additional Verve Loss and 10 Pres.  If you wait a third, this increases to 20 Verve Loss and 20 PRes.
name: Precise Shot

description: When resolving the Basic Ranged Attack Move, if your target is unaware of you or is Flanked, does not have the Cautious Status, and your weapon that has the Backstab Tag, then you perform a Sneak Attack.  You deal your normal Verve Loss and roll your Bonus Damage Dice two times, adding the results.  Additionally, you may upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice for this turn 1 rank for each Cloak you sacrifice.  After resolving this, you lose the Stealth Status and your target gains the Cautious Status.
name: Ranged Sneak Attack

description: When resolving the Basic Ranged Attack Move, if you have blunt ammunition or bolas, you may attempt to use Trip using your Ranged Weapon with a -3 penalty.  If you fail, apply your Verve Loss as normal.
name: Ranged Trip

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack with any number of targets receiving Blunt Ammunition shots.  You knock back each target, if there is a safe space for them to move back to.  Additionally, you knock them Prone on a Raw Roll of 19+
name: Blunt Ammo

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack with any number of targets receiving Piercing Ammunition shots.  For each that receive Piercing Ammunition, you pierce 2 PRed.
name: Piercing Ammo

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack with any number of targets receiving Splintering Ammunition shots.  For each that receive Splintering Ammunition, you apply 3 Verve Loss to all adjacent targets.
name: Splintering Ammo

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack with any number of targets receiving Curved Ammunition shots.  For each that receive Curved Ammunition, you may trace your straight shot and adjust the path by 3sq.
name: Curved Ammo

description: Resolve a Basic Ranged Attack with any number of targets receiving Ricocheting Ammunition shots.  For each that receive Ricocheting Ammunition, you may fire at a surface, and have it ricochet around to hit them.  When doing so, your target(s) have their PRes halved, but your range is halved.
name: Ricochet Ammo

description: You gain +1 Damage to your Attacks against creatures who are beneath you.
name: Vertical Shot

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you apply the Stagger Status to a creature if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 17+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 20+ for DC 4 creatures.
name: Staggering Ranged Attack

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you nullify its Special Defences if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 15+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 18+ for DC 4.  DC 5 and higher creatures cannot have their Defences nullified.
name: Dazing Ranged Attack

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you remove 1 points from its Charge Meter (or 2 on a Critical Hit), which it uses to power Special Attacks, if you exceed a Raw Roll.  The Raw Roll starts at 17+ for DC 1 creatures, and increases to 20+ for DC 4.
name: Exhausting Ranged Attack

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, if you target a single creature and halve your damage, you may reduce the movement speed of that creature by 2sq until your next turn.  On a Raw Roll of 19+, this lasts indefinitely.
name: Hobbling Ranged Attack

description: Instead of resolving a basic Attack, you attempt to pin a target via clothing or jewellry, to a wall or structure that your ammunition can pierce, and which is adjacent to your target.  If you beat a DC3, your target must spend 2 rounds of their Relocate Action attempting to escape.
name: Pin shot

description: You resolve the Basic Ranged Attack Move with an item that is not traditionally a weapon (such as a torch or chair) that is adjacent to you at a target up to 4 squares away.  Instead of calculating normal Verve Loss, you deal an amount relative to the danger posed by the item.
name: Throw Anything I

description: You resolve the Basic Ranged Attack Move with an item that is not traditionally a weapon (such as a torch or chair) that is adjacent to you at a target up to 4 squares away.  Instead of calculating normal Verve Loss, you deal an amount relative to the danger posed by the item.  This becomes a Free Action, and can repeat this as long as their are items at hand, up to 5 times.
name: Throw Anything II

description: When resolving Basic Ranged Attack, if you use a weapon with the Throwable Tag and you target is within 2sq of you, you apply 2 additional Verve Loss to them.
name: Short Throw

description: When behind a wall, pillar or defensible position, you may attempt to keep yourself defended and resolve a Ranged Basic Attack.  You gain +1 to the Dodge and Block Moves against Spells and Ranged attacks, but reduce your applicable Verve Loss by 3.
name: Cover Shot

description: If you are directly behind an ally and targeting one or more targets beyond your ally, resolve a Ranged Basic Attack.  You gain +1 to the Dodge and Block Moves against Spells and Ranged attacks, but reduce your applicable Verve Loss by 3.  Additionally, if you choose, your Ally can suffer a -1 to all Defences until the start of your nex turn for you to not suffer the Verve Loss penalty.
name: Human Shield

description: If you resolve Ranged Basic Attack splitting your damage between 2 adjacent targets, you apply an additional 3 Verve Loss between them.
name: Double Arrow

description: After resolving a Basic Ranged Attack, you may use Relocate up to 1sq. as a Free Action.
name: Acrobatic Shot

description: If you can run in a straight line at least 4sq to one of the targets of your Basic Ranged Attack, you apply an additional 3 Verve Loss to them.
name: Ranged Charge

description: Resolve the Ranged Basic Attack with double your weapon's range.  You critically fail on a 4-.
name: Pepper Shot

description: If you fire into a group with at least 6 Connected Participants, declare how many shots you make and split your Verve Loss.  Each shot applies an additional 2 Verve Loss, but the targets are chosen randomly.
name: Pincushion

description: If you fire into a group with at least 4 Connected Participants, resolve the Ranged Basic Attack with a single target.  On a Raw Roll of 11+ you deal your Bonus Damage Dice, but the target is randomised.
name: Wildshot

description: Whenever you kill an opponent, your next attack applies an additional 3 Verve Loss.
name: Kill Continuation

description: If you did not move any squares last turn, you apply an additional 1 Verve Loss when you resolve the Ranged Basic Attack Move.
name: Rooted Volley

description: Twice per combat, you may reroll all Damage Dice you rolled.  You may expend this ability on the same Roll twice, if you wish.
name: Seasoned Ranged Attack

description: You may use Ranged-only weapons when resolving Melee Basic Attacks or using the Melee Symbiosis Mod.
name: Bow Bash

description: If you missed with any of your Ranged Attacks, you may move your target 1sq into a safe space of your choosing.
name: Warning Shot

description: Your Bonus Damage Dice improves by 1 rank.
name: Biting Ranged Attack

description: You use your senses to perceive the world around you.
name: Perception

description: You may ask the DM a question about what you can perceive of the area around you.
name: Perceive

description: You may ask 2 questions of the DM when using the Perception Move.  Without the appropriate Mods, you may be disadvantages when asking about Tracking or appraising creatures.
name: Perceptive

description: Resolve a Perception Move as a Quick Action.
name: Rapid Eye

description: You may ask the DM a question about tracks or the movement of creatures in the area recently.
name: Tracking I

description: You may ask the DM 2 questions when using the Tracking Mod, or you gain +1 to a Move relating to the information you gained from asking about Tracking.
name: Tracking II

description: You may ask the DM a question about the Damage, Defenses or Elemental Synergies a creature might have.
name: Appraise Creature I

description: You may ask the DM a question about the Damage, Defenses or Elemental Synergies a creature might have.  You gain +2 to your next Move against the creature.  You may use this ability once per creature.
name: Appraise Creature II

description: You may ask the DM a question about the Special Attack(s) or Special Defense(s) a creature might have.
name: Study Creature

description: If you have less than 10% of your HP remaining and are in Combat, you gain a +5 bonus to the Perception Move.
name: Adrenal Perception

description: Resolve the Perceive Move on a creature that took damage.  Your Melee or Ranged Basic Attacks apply an additional 1 Verve Loss to that creature.  You may use this ability once per creature.
name: Quick Study I

description: Resolve the Perceive Move on a creature.  You gain the maximum value of your Bonus Damage Dice against it the next time you target it with a Melee or Ranged Basic Attack.  You may use this ability once per battle.
name: Quick Study II

description: Until the start of your next turn, you incur no penalty to the DC for Defend Moves against invisible and hidden creatures.
name: Subtle Clues

description: You can ask the DM what percentage of health a creature has left.
name: Sense Health

description: You may choose 2 Mods when resolving Perceive.
name: Eye master

description: You consult your knowledge on a Topic you have learned, heard about, or is part of your cultural identity.
name: Knowing

description: You attempt to recall knowledge about History.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall History

description: You attempt to recall common knowledge about Religion.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall Religion

description: You attempt to recall common knowledge about magic and the arcane.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall Arcane

description: You attempt to recall common knowledge about survival, the weather, or the behaviour of common creatures.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall Survival

description: You attempt to recall common knowledge about the streets, such as the types of people that you would find in certain districts, and the layout of cities.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall the Streets

description: You attempt to recall common knowledge about non-magical health and wellbeing, and the methods for treating non-magical health and wellbeing conditions.  If you beat the DC, you may ask the DM one question or recall the knowledge of how to treat the condition.  You may only recall knowledge up to DC 2.
name: Recall Health

description: You make an appraisal using your knowledge to determine an object's relative value
name: Appraise

description: Instead of asking questions, you discern your location and general direction based on the movement of the sun, the wind and other factors.  You can use this to help when you are lost, or improve your travel times by a small amount.
name: Survival Knowledge: Pathfinder

description: Instead of asking questions, you spend an hour to try to find 0-3 common foods or alchemical reagents outside of populated areas.  If travelling, your incur a -2 Penalty and the search inhibits your travel speed.
name: Survival Knowledge: Foraging I

description: Instead of asking questions, you spend an hour to try to find 0-1 uncommon foods or alchemical reagents outside of populated areas.  If travelling, your incur a -2 Penalty and the search inhibits your travel speed.
name: Survival Knowledge: Foraging II

description: When using Recall Knowledge, you may ask 2 questions.
name: Know-it-all

description: Resolve the Appraise Move.  You may learn the DC of performing a Move that you have at least 1 point in.
name: Difficulty Appraisal

description: You may use the Knowing Move as a Quick Action.
name: Rapid Recall

description: You attempt trigger the magic in a Scroll, Wand, Rod or Amulet that requires intimate knowledge, or magical aptitude.  You succeed if you beat the DC of the item.
name: Trigger Magic

description: You give an adjacent Ally +1 to one of the following Skills for 1 turn: Perception, Knowing, Influence, Alchemy, Arts/Craft, Engineering, Beast Mastery, Spellcraft.
name: Intimate Knowledge

description: You may ask the DM a question about a creature's known weaknesses, known strengths, or its best attribute.
name: Bestiary

description: You know inherently the weaknesses of a creature whose DC is no greater than 3.  If you share this knowledge with your allies, the creature loses 5% of it's remaining hitpoints.  You may use this once per creature.
name: Weakpoint Study

description: You resolve Recall Knowledge as a Primary Action this turn.  You gain a bonus Primary Action next turn.
name: Pick the right time

description: Instead of resolving the Recall Knowledge Move normally, you attempt to understand something you may have heard somewhere.  For less esoteric knowledge, on a Raw Roll of 16+ you succeed and may ask a single question about it, even if you are not familiar with a topic.  For more specialised knowledge, you succeed on a 19+ instead.  For knowledge of Godly import, you only succeed on a Raw Roll of 20.  On any failing Roll, you cannot use this Mod again until you next Rest, and you may never use this Mod on this topic again.
name: I heard that somewhere

description: All allies perceivable within 10sq gain 2 UDR until the start of your next turn.
name: Master Tactician

description:
Resolve the Recall Knowledge Move.  You generate 1 Study for a creature you can perceive and others of its exact type.  As a Free Action, you can spend Study for different effects:
- 2 Study: Ignore a Basic Attack from this creature.
- 2 Study: Gain +1 to Defences Moves against this creature for the duration of the combat.  You may only do this once per combat.
- 3 Study: You apply an additional 3 Verve Loss to these creatures for the remainder of the combat.
- 3 Study: Ignore a Special Attack from creatures of this type.
- 3 Study: Gain an additional Primary Action against a creature of this type.
name: Careful Study

description: Resolve a Recall Move.  You generate 2 Mana, or 1 Psi, Ki or Sanctity.  Alternatively, you can adjust your Rage by 2, either higher or lower.
name: Meditate I

description: Resolve a Recall Move.  You generate 4 Mana, or 2 Psi, Ki or Sanctity.  Alternatively, you can adjust your Rage by 4, either higher or lower.
name: Meditate II

description: Whenever you hear or see a language you don't know, you may resolve a Recall Move.  On a Raw Roll of 16+ you have a decent idea about the meaning.  On a Raw Roll of 12+ you have a faint idea.
name: Linguist

description: Resolve the Recall History Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.
name: Historical Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall History Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.
name: Historical Knowledge II

description: Resolve the Recall Religion Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.
name: Religious Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall Religion Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.
name: Religious Knowledge II

description: Resolve the Recall Arcane Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.
name: Arcane Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall Arcane Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.
name: Arcane Knowledge II

description: Resolve the Recall Survival Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.
name: Survival Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall Survival Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.
name: Survival Knowledge II

description: Resolve the Recall the Streets Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.  You additionally have partial knowledge of various dialects of Thieves Cant, a wordless language of symbols and gestures that let theives communicate clandistinely.
name: Street Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall the Streets Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.  You additionally have full knowledge of all dialects of Thieves Cant.
name: Street Knowledge II

description: Resolve the Recall Health Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 4.
name: Medicinal Knowledge I

description: Resolve the Recall Health Move.  You may recall knowledge up to DC 6.  You may also attempt to remove the Dying Status from an adjacent character.
name: Medicinal Knowledge II

description: You gain +1 Maximum Mana and PSI.
name: Font

description: You attempt to sneak and hide from targets that do not have the Cautious Status.
name: Stealthery

description:
You attempt to sneak and hide from targets that do not have the Cautious Status.  If you succeed, at a DC set by the DM based on the difficulty of the situation and the number of people you are hiding from, you gain the Stealth Status.  If your condition changes, you may lose the Stealth Status or be asked to resolve Stealth again.

Some Mods may also give you Cloak.  Whenever you gain any amount of Cloak, it replaces whatever Cloak you already had.  Whenever you may lose the Stealth Status and you are in an environment where you can maintain your Stealth, you may expend a Cloak to resolve the Stealth Move again, though this does not work on targets that have the Cautious Status.  You may store a number of Cloak equal to the number of Points in Stealth you have.
name: Stealth

description: Resolve the Stealth Move as a Quick Action.
name: Quick Stealth

description: Resolve the Stealth Move.  On a Raw Roll of 11+ you gain 1 Cloak.
name: Cloaked Figure

description: Resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed, then on a Raw Roll of 16+ you gain 2 Cloak.
name: Desperate Cloak

description: Resolve the Stealth Move at a DC Penalty equal to the number of adjacent enemies.  If you succeed, you enter Stealth and you gain as many Cloak as the number of adjacent enemies, or 3, whichever is lower.  If you fail, the Stealth Move cost a Primary Action, even if used in conjunction with a Mod, item or effect that makes Stealth a Quick Action.
name: Risky Cloak

description: If you have at least one adjacent target, and all are Flanked, resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed, then on a Raw Roll of 13+, a creature with the Cautious Status loses this Status.
name: Blind Spot: Disappear

description: If you performed no offensive Moves last turn, resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed then a creature with the Cautious Status loses this Status.
name: No trace

description: If there are no creatures within 10sq of you, resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed, a creature with the Cautious Status loses this Status.
name: Forgettable

description: If you are above all targets you wish to remain hidden from, resolve the Stealth Move with a +1 Bonus.  If you succeed, you gain 1 Cloak.
name: Rooftop Runner

description: If you are part of a group with at least 6 connected participants, resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed, any creature who has the Cautious Status loses it.
name: Stealth by Confusion

description: If you are part of a group with at least 6 connected participants, resolve the Stealth Move with a +3 Bonus.
name: In the Mix

description: Resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed you remove the Cautious Status of a target who is behind an ally you are adjacent to.
name: Slinking Allies

description: Resolve the Stealth Move.  If you succeed, then instead of being unseen and unheard, you are considered Flanking a creature that you threaten, until the end of your next turn.
name: Forced Flanking

description: If you have less than 20% of your HP remaining and move to a location where you cannot be seen, you immediately enter Stealth successfully and gain 1 Cloak.
name: Adrenal Vamoose

description: If you are in a position to hide or disappear from someone's perception, or you have an item which facilitates this, then you Resolve the Stealth Move automatically and prepare yourself.  All basic attacks from enemies miss you until the start of your next turn.  As long as there was at least one attack aimed at you, you remove the Cautious Status from anyone who attacked you and you enter Stealth.  If you needed to use an item to facilitate your hide, you may use this as a Free Action and, unless it is very difficult to operate, it resolves successfully.
name: Ghost

description: You start Combat with 1 Cloak, which you can use after you first successfuly resolve the Stealth Move.
name: Cloak Master

description: You may expend a Cloak to re-roll a failed Stealth Move Roll.
name: Cloaked Retreat

description: You may expend a Cloak to apply your Bonus Damage Dice to a target that does not have the Cautious Status.  If you have the Stealth Status, you apply the maximum value of the Bonus Damage Dice, and lose the Stealth Status.
name: Cunning Riposte

description: You have a number of sneaky physical tricks you can perform, and you have streetwise experience with traps and locks.
name: Subterfuge

description: You attempt to pick the pocket of a target to whom you are unseen and unheard. If you beat the target's Defence (WIS), you take something of value that is available in their pockets, or on an accessory belt or similar.  You can typically steal items or coin up to the value of 10 Standards per point in Subterfuge.  If you try to steal something more valuable, the DC increases.  You cannot use this Move in Combat.
name: Pick Pocket

description: You perform a feat of dexterity with your hands, that succeeds either based on the onlookers' Defence (WIS), or their Dodge (DEX), depending on the situation.  Such acts include juggling, taking something in sight, hiding something on your person quickly, swiping an object or distracting someone from looking at a part of your body.
name: Legerdemain

description: You attempt to create a disguise of props and distraction, assuming you have the materials to do so.  Disguising yourself takes time and is longer than a Primary Action.  You resolve this Move when under scrutiny by someone who would want to see through your disguise, based on the DC of the Defence (WIS).  You may gain a bonus to your roll if you also encorporate a successful perform resolved using the Perform Move.
name: Disguise

description: You've experienced disarming common traps in your past.  You can find and disarm traps up to DC 2 as per the Locksmith Engineering Move.  If you have 6 points in Subterfuge, this raises to DC 3, and again to DC4 at 10 points.
name: Uncanny Trapwork

description: You've experienced picking locks in your past.  You can pick locks up to DC 2 as per the Locksmith Engineering Move.  If you have 6 points in Subterfuge, this raises to DC3, and again to DC4 at 10 points.
name: Uncanny Lockwork

description: Instead of resolving Pick Pocket or Legerdemain as normal, on a Raw Roll of 18+ you succeed, and on a Raw Roll of 3- you fail.  Anything inbetween has no effect.  You may use this even if your target has the Cautious Status.
name: Rushed and Risky

description: If you successfully used a Defence Move against a target last turn, you gain +1 to Subterfuge Moves.
name: Defended Sleight

description: If you are hidden from a target by an adjacent ally, you may resolve the Stealth Move against them which automatically succeeds.  Your next Move Roll against viable targets gain +1, but they then gain the Cautious Status.
name: Coop Surprise

description: You scoop up dust and dirt and throw it in the face of a target who has eyes.   On a Raw Roll of 17+ you apply the Blind Status to them for 1 turn.  On a Raw Roll of 16-, you may attempt the Stealth Move as a Free Action with no Mods.
name: Blinding Dirt

description: If you are in combat with 2 adjacent targets, you attempt to feint at one but attack the other.  Resolve the Legerdemain Move against the target's Defence (WIS).  If you are successful, you apply 3 more Verve Damage on your next Basic Melee Attack.
name: Feint

description: If you are hit by a Basic Attack in combat and you have an adjacent ally, you may resolve the Legerdemain Move against your target's Dodge (DEX).  If you succeed, your ally takes the hit instead.
name: False Hit

description: After being hit by a Basic Attack, until the end of your next turn you may resolve the Legerdemain Move against your attacker's Defence (WIS).  On a success, their next attack against you applies 5 less Verve Loss.
name: False Blood

description: You may use the Pick Pocket Move against targets in Combat, but may only steal something that is visible and easily acquired - like a potion, alchemical, or something in their hand.
name: Steal I

description: If your target has the Bound Status, such as when grappled, you may attempt to take something from a target in combat that is visible and accessible, or in an accessible pack.  You may even be able to slip rings and brooches off.  You may ask your DM if this is a possible move before you attempt it.
name: Steal II

description: You delay a creature's Special Countdown and disable their Special Defences until the start of your next turn.
name: Distraction

description: You automatically take a Potion, Scroll, Alchemical or Gadget that is in an adjacent opponent's item belt or otherwise visible on their person.
name: Mug

description: Once per turn when you have at least 1 Cloak, you may reduce the Verve Loss of an attack by 1, or apply 1 additional Verve Loss on a Basic Melee or Ranged Attack.
name: Sly Guy

description: You sway the opinions and emotions of those around you.  Some Moves require that you share a language.
name: Influence

description: You anger or provoke someone, applying the Provoked Status to them if you beat a DC against their Defence (CHA).
name: Provoke

description: You intimidate someone, applying the Intimidated Status to them if you beat a DC against their Defence (CHA).
name: Intimidate

description: You dissuade someone against performing an action, applying the Dissuaded Status to them if you beat a DC against their Defence (CHA).  You must share a language with your target.
name: Dissuade

description: You convince to perform an action or make a certain decision, if you beat a DC against their Defence (CHA).  You target must have some interest for making the decision, or you must provide them with one or have leverage over them.  You must share a language with your target.
name: Convince

description: You demoralise an opponent, applying the Demoralised Status to them if you beat a DC against their Defence (CHA).  You must share a language with your target.
name: Demoralise

description: You encourage an ally, applying the Encouraged Status to them if you beat a DC of 2.  You must share a language with your target.
name: Encourage

description: You sense the motives of creature.  If you beat the enemy's Defence (CHA), you may ask the DM a question about whether they are lying or withholding information, or if their intentions differ from their words or actions.  The DM may be creative in their answer.
name: Sense Motive

description: If your target is within your Threatening Range, resolve the Provoke Move with a +5 Bonus.
name: Provoker

description: After being the target of a Ranged Attack, you may resolve the Dissuade Move, with yourself as the dissuaded target, as a Quick Action.
name: No, not me!

description: If you move away at least 4sq from a target, you may resolve the Dissuade Move, with yourself as the dissuaded target, as a Quick Action.
name: Meek

description: If you move at least 4sq directly towards a target, you resolve the Provoke or Intimidate Move as a Quick Action.
name: Intimidator

description: If you have at least one adjacent target, and all are Flanked and do not have the Cautious Status, you may resolve the Dissuade or Intimidate Move as a Quick Action.
name: Blind Spot: Threat

description: If you killed an opponent this round, Influence Moves are resolved as a Quick Action.
name: Let that be a warning

description: If you succeed at a Defence Move against an adjacent target, you may resolve the Provoke, Intimidate or Dissuade Move against them as a Quick Action.
name: Mocking Retort

description: Resolve the Intimidate Move.  If you succeed, any enemy that enters or starts in your Threatening Range cannot enter any other square of your Threatening Range, nor pass in a direction you specify.
name: Unpassable

description: Resolve the Convince Move at a DC equal to the number of Allies you wish to Inspire within 10sq.  If you are successful, they each Gain 4 Verve.  You may only use this in the tense situation of combat and if at least one of your targets has less than 50% Verve remaining.
name: Inspiring Word

description: When you are in a combat with at least 6 connected participants, resolve Dissuade against a target.  If you are successful, you apply the Confused Status to your target.
name: Distract

description: [With your body language and presence, you may be able to get a ranged attacker to shift to a nearby position]
name: Corral

description: Resolve the Provoke Move against the highest Defence (CHA) of all enemies with Ranged Attacks.  If you are successul, all enemies with Ranged Attacks gain the Provoked Status until the start of your next turn.
name: Focus Fire

description: An hour after you have applied 2 Standard coins worth of exfoliant and perfumes, you gain +2 to the Convince Move when your target would appreciate a good skin regime.  This bonus increases to 3 if you use 10 Standards worth of materials.
name: Excuisitely Exfoliated Skin

description: You use your charm on someone who might be romantically interested in you, leveraging that interest to improve your Convince Move against them.  If your request could be improved by flirtation, you gain a +1 to your Roll to Resolve Convince.
name: Flirt

description: Resolve the Provoke Move against a target within your Threatening Range who is not Cautious.  If you beat their Defences, you lock yourself in step and you both gain the Duelling Status, with yourself as the initiator.  If you fail, instead Resolve a Basic Melee Attack.
name: Duel

description: You lock yourself in step with 2 targets within your Threatening Range and you all gain the Duelling Status, with yourself as the Initiator.
name: Grand Duel

description: After noting a failing Move made by an Ally, resolve the Encourage Move.  If you beat the DC, in addition to the Encouraged Status they get +1 to their next attempt at the same Move.  You may use this Mod at most once per hour.
name: Get back on that horse

description: When you use Influence to resolve Provoke in combat, you immediately succeed at a Provoke with you as the target, for a single target.
name: Challenge

description: When resolving Sense Motive, instead of understanding your target's motive or the truth, you see subtle motions that imply a strong emotion they may be feeling.  The DC for resolving Sense Motive this way is reduced by 1.
name: Empathy

description: Resolve the Sense Motive Move on a target in Combat.  If you beat the target's Defence (CHA), you provide a +1 Bonus to the Dodge or Block Moves to one ally you can perceive.
name: Battlefield Tactician

description: Instead of resolving the Sense Motive Move, you move all allies within 10sq, 1sq, each in a direction of your choice.
name: Battlefield Commander

description: Resolve the Sense Motive Move on a target in Combat.  If you beat the target's Defence (CHA), you may ask the DM what motives this creature has, as well as one of the following: what target they prefer, or anything they might prefer to avoid.  You gain a +2 Bonus to resolve this Move.
name: Combat Motives

description: Resolve the Sense Motive Move on a target in Combat.  If you beat the target's Defence (CHA), you may instead ask the DM how far off a creature is from its Special Attack, or whether it wants to cast a spell next round.  You also gain +2 to one Move from the Defences Category, but you must choose now which Move gains that bonus.  You gain a +2 Bonus to resolve this Move.
name: Magical Motives

description: You cannot be surprised until the end of your next turn, plus you gain the Cautious Status.
name: Cautioned

description: When you don't share a languages with your target, instead of the Convince and Dissuade Moves being impossible, they incurs a penatly which the DM will determine based on the situation.
name: Internationalist

description: You may resolve the Sense Motive Move with an additional Mod.
name: Eye master

description: You may resolve the Sense Motive Move in Combat as a Quick Action.
name: Rapid Eye

description: You use your body to create a performance.
name: Perform (Deprecated)

description: You are accomplished in the field of engineering, able to review and understand, and sometimes build and repair, engineered items from clockwork to castles.
name: Engineer

description: You can use engineering to create and dismantle non-magical locks.  Creating a lock takes 1 day per DC of the lock.  Unlocking one takes 1 minute per DC.  The maximum DC of Lock you can create or dismantle is based on the number of points in Engineer: DC of 2 at 1 point, DC 3 at 3 points, DC 4 at 5 points, DC 5 at 7 points, and DC 6 at 9 points.
name: Locksmith
