description: You can use engineering to find, create and dismantle non-magical traps.  Creating a mechanical trap takes 1 day per DC of the trap.  Disarming one takes 1 minute per DC.  Creating or disarming a more natural trap takes only a minute to create or disarm.  The maximum DC of Trap you can find, create or dismantle is based on the number of points in Engineer: DC of 2 at 1 point, DC 3 at 3 points, DC 4 at 5 points, DC 5 at 7 points, and DC 6 at 9 points.
name: Trapsmith

description: You understand the structural basis of buildings and man-made spaces, as well as gear work and mechanicals (excluding Gadgetry). If you beat the DC of the item, you understand part of the item, and can contribute to it or begin to understand how to disable it.
name: Construction

description: You can create and repair armours, weaponry, and items of metals and leather.  The DC to create an item is the item's value divided by 10, and the time it takes is 1 day per DC.  To repair, the DC and duration is halved, or sometimes quartered.
name: Smithing

description: You attempt to break a lock instead of pick it.  Resolve the Locksmith Move at a DC 1 lower than normal.  On a Raw Roll of 7- you damage the lock, potentially jamming the door or chest closed.
name: Break Lock

description: Resolve the Construction Move.  If you succeed, you know where to hit a structure or material to apply the most damage.  The structure's UDR is reduced, the DM will determine by how much.
name: Structural Weakness

description: Resolve the Smithing skill against a DC of 2.  If you succeed, you improve up to 2 basic weapons or pieces of armour to the equivalent of the Fine version, for the duration of the next combat.   Doing so takes 30 minutes of preparation, and requires materials costing 5 standards.
name: Well-oiled

description: When resolving Trapsmith to attempt to disarm a trap, you gain 3 UDR against any immediate trap effects that affect you.
name: Instinctive Mechanics

description: You gain 5 UDR against Verve Loss applied by Gadgets.
name: Adjacent Knowledge

description: You are a tinker of gadgets, with a clear understanding of building and deploying gadgetry, even if you have no idea about general engineering.
name: Gadgetry

description:
You craft a Gadget from raw materials and your talent.  To craft a Gadget, pick a Gadget Schematic.  If you beat the DC of the Gadget, you spend the materials to create the Gadget, as well as spending 4 hours per DC.  You do not need to spend the time in one block.

Initially, you can only create Gadgetry Items.
name: Craft Gadget

description: You use a Gadget that you have created and which is handy or on your accessory belt.
name: Use Gadget

description: Resolve Use Gadget outside of combat with a +1 Bonus.
name: Careful Gadgetry

description: You can craft Autogols from the Gadgets list.
name: Craft Autogol

description: You can craft Equipment Mods from the Gadgets list.
name: Craft Equipment Mods

description: You can craft Launchers from the Gadgets list.
name: Craft Launchers

description: You can craft Traps from the Gadgets list.
name: Craft Trap

description: Resolve the Craft Gadget Move.  If you succeed, at half the DC of a Gadget you are targeting, you dismantle and regain the primary materials and half the Standard Coins back.  This works even on a defunct Gadgets, but not one that is unrecognisable, such as explosives.
name: Dismantle Gadget

description: If you double the crafting time when resolving Craft a Gadget, its DC drops by 2 and the Standard Coins cost is halved.
name: Dedicated Tinker

description: If you increase the DC of a crafted gadgey by 1, and double the Standard Coins cost, the crafting time when resolving the Craft Gadget Move is halved.
name: Privileged Tinker

description: Resolve the Use Gadget Move on an Autogol.  For the next three turns, the Autogol's Verve Loss application is doubled.
name: Supergol

description: You gain the Inspired Status when you are within 3sq of one of your Autogols or Gadgeted Traps.
name: Smugness

description: You use your creativity to create a work of art.
name: Creativity

description: You paint, craft, or otherwise create a piece of art.  The DC is based on the relative difficulty of the piece, and your familiarity with the artform, and it takes 4-8 hours per DC of the item.  Created works are typically worth 10-20 Standards per DC of the item, and typically cost 2 Standards per DC.
name: Create Artwork

description: You create a performance, of song, dance, comedy or drama; one in which you've had experience or the talent for.  The DC is based on the general target's Defence (CHA), modified by the difficulty of the performance.  You can typically charge 10-20 Standards per DC of the performance, though its value reduces over time.  Composing or preparing the work is typically 2 days per DC.
name: Create Performance

description: You attempt to create a work of food.  If feeding a crew, you resolve this automatically.  If attempting to impress, or otherwise use cooking to your advantage, you must beat an easy DC.
name: Cooking

description: Resolve the Craft Artwork Move.  You may either reduce the time to create it by 2-4 hours, or the cost to do so by 5-10 Standards.
name: Quick Artist

description: When presenting the results of Craft Artwork as a gift, that is at least a DC 3, you gain +3 to the Influence Move against the person receiving the gift.
name: Artist's Influence

description: When you successfully resolve Create Performance, you gain +2 to the Influence Skill against targets you performed for.  The specific Move bonus gained is based on the type of performance, such as gaining a bonus to the Intimidate Move if you perform a battle performance.
name: Performer's Influence

description: You gain +2 to Rolls to protect something that you've created, whether by Art/Craft or Smithing or another applicable Skill.
name: Fiercely Protective

description: When you make a work, on a Raw Roll of 20 you create a piece worthy of the ages.  The value is increased twofold, and it is desired by those who appreciate art.
name: Work of Genius

description: You are experienced with non-magical herbs and alchemicals.
name: Alchemy

description:
You craft a non-magical alchemical from herbs and equipment that you have available.  To craft an Alchemical, you need to beat the DC of the item, and spend an hour per DC as well as sacrifice ingredients that match the Alchemical recipe.  DC 1 Alchemicals can be created without equipment.  DC 2 requires equipment available in a standard Alchemical Travel Bag or a kitchen.  DC 3 or higher requires a kitchen or alchemy lab.  DC 4 and higher may only be created using specialised equipment in an alchemy lab.

If you fail to create the Alchemical, choose an option: 1) Recover the materials: You spend the entire time that it would take to create the Alchemical, but you recover the materials that your recipe required (and no additional reagents expended as part of Mods or equipment).  2) Recover the Time: You fail fast, and are able to quit before you waste much time. You only spend 10 minutes on this attempt.
name: Craft Alchemical

description: You extract the core essences of Alchemical Reagents.  If you have access to moderate alchemical tools, a Fine Alchemical FieldKit, or a kitchen or laboratory, you can extract each individual Effect from a Reagent into the equivalent Alchemical Extracts.  You typically have enough time to perform this on one alchemical per day.  This increases to 2 when you have at least 4 points in Alchemy, and 3 when you have 8.  When you attempt this, Resolve Transmute Alchemy against a DC of the rarity of the alchemical you are attempting this on.  On a success, you extract all Effects.  On a failure, one Effect of your choice is lost.
name: Transmute Alchemical

description: On a Raw Roll of 19+, you create a Perfect Creation.  One numeric effect has +1 added to it, or the duration increases by 1 round.  Choose when you create the alchemical.
name: Perfect Creation I

description: On a Raw Roll of 17+, you create a Perfect Creation.  One numeric effect has +1 added to it, or the duration increases by 1 round.  Choose when you create the alchemical.
name: Perfect Creation II

description: When your perform the Alchemy Move and you increase the recipe by 2 Reagents (of any type that the Recipe requires), the DC of the Recipe is reduced by 1.
name: Concentrated Solution

description: When creating Alchemical Recipes that have an affect in a radius, you may increase the DC to also increase the radius by the same amount.
name: Spring Loaded Mechanisms

description: When creating an Alchemical that requires at least two Alchemical Reagent Effects, you may reduce the number required by 1, by doubling the creation time.
name: Improvised Alchemy

description: You may restock your ammunition belt or container with up to 6 Alchemicals.  If you successfully Dodged a creature last round, you may hurriedly restock just 1 as a Free Action.
name: Restock

description: You may use up to 5 Alchemicals this round, each on a unique target within range, from anywhere on your person or in your pack.
name: Rapid Alchemy

description: Resolve the Craft Alchemical Move.  If you beat the DC equal to half the DC of an adjacent magical creature or undead that took 10 Verve Loss this turn, you quickly and safely scoop up its bodily weepings.  As part of this Move, you can either transfer it to a safe container, or immediately resolve a Basic Ranged Attack as a Free Action to hurl it at a target.  If thrown, you add a pinch of something herbacious that excites the weeping, dealing 5 Damage to your target.  If saved, you gain a Wept Solvent.
name: Black Blood Bomb

description: If you have your alchemical ingredients in your Item Belt, you can create DC 1 Alchemicals as a Quick Action.  However on a Raw Roll of 5- they spill and apply to you at half strength.
name: Hasty Concoction

description: You gain the Inspired Status when you are within 3sq a creature under the effects of one of your Alchemicals.
name: Smug Alchemist

description: You can soothe and sway the actions of animals and beasts, and you can attempt to ride horses and other ridable animals, but find yourself tired over long periods.
name: Animal Empathy

description: Descibe how you wish to change the actions or emotion of a beast target, such as a wolf or other animal.  If you pierce their defenses, the DC of which is set by their Defend (CHA) and the willingness of the target, then you describe how you achieve the change.  Some creatures will not change their instinctive behaviour unless you show a compelling reason for them to.
name: Soothe Animal

description: You attempt to ride at speed, or at distance, or to perform a maneuvre without issue.  The DC will be determined by the DM based on the willingness of the animal and the difficulty of the action or maneuvre you are attempting.  If you fail, you may gain the Exhausted Status.
name: Riding

description: You issue a command to your companion that you've trained them in.  Commands last for 2 rounds, unless they are superceded by a new Command.  You know 1 Command per point you spend in Animal Empathy, and you can only learn Advanced Commands once you have 5 points in Animal Empathy.
name: Command Beast

description: If you can understand the motives of the monster, you may be able to Soothe it.  Resolve Soothe Animal with the monster as your target with a -3 penalty.  If you fail, the DM will describe something useful about its nature to you.
name: Soothe Monster

description: Resolve the Soothe Animal Move at a DC of your mount's Defence (CHA).  If you succeed, Basic Melee or Ranged Attacks resolved apply +1 Verve Loss per sq. you moved this turn.
name: Mounted Combatant

description: Resolve Command Beast.  Your command lasts until the end of battle, or 5 minutes, whichever is shorter.
name: Lasting Commnad

description: Using the Command Beast Move is a Quick Action.
name: Affinity

description: You may use Command Beast with a special command: Harry.  Your beast gains +2 Move sq and will move towards a target you nominate.  If it reaches, it deals 1 damage and attempt to get back to you.  Your companions cannot be the target of attacks this round.
name: Harrying

description: Resolve the Command Beast Move.  You may Command your Companion against a creature that took at least 10 damage last round.  Your Companion becomes enraged with bloodlust, becoming immune to mental effects, gaining 3sq movement, and applying 2 additional Verve Loss with its attack, however they will ignore further commands until the target is killed.
name: Out for blood

description: If you have less than 15% of your HP remaining, you can issue two commands to your Companion.
name: Protective Companion

description: You may swap places with an adjacent Companion.
name: Swap places

description: When using Command Beast, you may issue up to three commands.  They gain an additional Primary Action.
name: Multi-command

description: Your companion applies 1 additional Verve Loss against targets you successfully used the Block or Dodge Move on last turn.
name: Defender Companion Combo

description: If you and your companion each sacrifice 3 Verve, you may resolve Command Beast with 2 Mods.
name: Commander

description: If you fall into the Moribund state, your companion will become Hasted and Raged in order to defend your corpse.
name: Fallen Hero

description: When resolving Melee Basic Attacks while mounted, you do not incur the Verve Loss or Defence Move penalty.
name: Mounted Combat Afficionado

description: You are proficient at riding horses and are no longer tired by riding them, nor are they tired up to 20km of travel.
name: Horse Riding I

description: You are proficient at riding horses and are no longer tired by riding them, nor are they tired up to 40km of travel.  Additionally, you ignore the effects of difficult terrain while mounted.
name: Horse Riding II

description: You aim to be a master of spells
name: Spellcraft

description: When performing this Move, you determine if you comprehend a new spell whose level is equal to up to half your points in Spellcraft. You may attempt to comprehend a spell, even if you have failed to comprehend it before, a maximum of once per day.  Comprehending a spell takes 2 hours per Level of the spell.  For each point you purchase in Spell Knowledge, you may have 2 Spells in your known list.
name: Learn Spell

description: You may perform this Move when you purchase a point in Spellcraft.  When you do, you may remove up to 2 Spells from your known Spells.
name: Forget Spell

description: Resolve the Learn Spell Move as a Quick Action.  You attempt to identify a spell as it is being cast.
name: Identify Spell

description: When you see a Spell being cast, resolve the Learn Spell Move.  If you beat the DC of the spell, you may forget a spell and learn that spell automatically, if the spell is learnable.
name: Field Learner

description: Resolve the Spellcraft Move at the DC of a spell that you don't know.  If you succeed, you may resolve Cast a Spell Move with the spell you chose. You may not choose Spells that are beyond your level in Spellcraft.
name: Weird Flow

description: When purchasing a point in Spellcraft, you instantly and automatically learn any spell you choose that has a DC of 2 or lower.
name: Sorcerer

description: You have the ability to shape The Flow into spells of power.
name: Cast

description: You may cast a spell, invoking it's Cantrip, Standard or Overpowered effect if you pay its Mana cost.  Many spells require you to beat the Defences of your target.  Your spell has no effect and the Mana is expended if you fail to beat your target's Defences.
name: Cast a Spell

description: You may resolve the Jump Move to jump backwards up to 2sq backwards as a Quick Action, just before casting a spell.
name: Acrobatic Cast: Defensive

description: You may resolve the Jump Move to jump towards a target up to 2sq as a Quick Action, just before casting a spell.
name: Acrobatic Cast: Offensive

description: When casting a spell as a cantrip, you may cast it as a Quick Action for 1 Stamina
name: Quick Cantrip I

description: When casting a spell as a cantrip, you may cast it as a Quick Action.
name: Quick Cantrip II

description: If you Move at least 2sq in the direction of a Cone you cast, the Cone's shape is 1sq longer, but the width does not increase
name: Volumous Cone

description: If you Move at least 3sq towards the target of a SVT spell, you gain +1 to your Cast a Spell Move Roll.
name: Flash Firing

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move with a spell that has a Resistance of Defend (DEX).  You pierce your target's resistance with a +5 bonus to your Cast a Spell Move Roll.
name: Focus Firing

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move against a target that successfully resisted a spell against you this combat.  You gain a +1 Bonus to the Move Roll.
name: Resist Piercer

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move that has a resistance.  If you do not beat your target's Defencese, you still apply 1/4 of the effects and duration.
name: Insistent Piercer

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move with a Spell that has a resistance that uses Defend (WIS), Defend (INT), Defend (CON) or Defend (CHA).  If your target resists, you get helf the Mana used to cast the spell back.
name: Reimbursed Flow

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move using a spell with the SVT shape against a target that is exactly 3 squares away from you at the start of your turn.  You gain +5 to the Damage or Verve Healing effect.  You may only use this ability twice per target.
name: Sweet Spot

description: When behind a wall, pillar or defensible position, you may attempt to keep yourself defended and resolve the Cast a Spell Move.  You gain a +2 bonus to the Dodge Move and Block (STR) Move Rolls against Spells and Ranged attacks, but suffer -2 to your rolls to pierce your target's defenses.
name: Cover Casting

description: If you cast a DC 2 or higher spell, the power of your blast pushes you back 3sq after resolving the Spell.
name: Powerful Blast

description: If you used Basic Melee Attack on a target last round, spells you cast that use Touch or Single Visible Target and which target that creature cost 1 less Mana this turn.
name: Slice and cast

description: On a Raw Roll of 11+, your spell costs 2 Mana less (to a minimum of 1, or a minimum of 0 for Cantrips).  Otherwise it costs 2 Mana more, but you may add 2 to any stated number in the effects, other than duration.
name: Wild Magic

description: On a Raw Roll of 19+, add 4 to one of the numeric effects of your spell, or reduce the Mana by 2, or extend the duration by 2 rounds.  On a 2-, the DM can choose the target, change an aspect of the spell, or cancel the spell with the mana still being used.
name: Torrent Cast

description: You may resolve a Cantrip Touch spell as a Quick Action against a target you successfully Blocked or Dodged last turn.
name: Defensive Cast I

description: You may resolve a Cantrip or Standard Touch spell as a Quick Action against a target you attempted to Block or Dodge.  This may even occur during the opponent's turn.
name: Defensive Cast II

description: You may channel a spell through an Ally within 2sq of you.  The shape and range of the spell is treated as originating from them. In addition, any touch spell can be delivered via weapon attack.
name: OutSourced Cast

description: Resolve the Cast a Spell Move with Spell that has a strength determined by rolling Dice.  The values of any variable Dice are taken at their maximum.
name: Maximised Magic

description: You cast a spell, which takes three times the normal time to cast.  It stores in your body indefinitely, unless dispelled or released.  While you have a Prepared Spell, your total mana is reduced by the Mana value of the spell and rank you cast it at and you are slightly easier to detect with the Detect Magic spell.
name: Prepared Spell

description: If you are struck in combat, you may release your Prepared Spell as pure magic, dealing 5 Magical Damage to all adjacent characters.
name: Prepared Expulsion

description: You release and cast your Prepared Spell using a lower spell rank than your prepared it with as a Free Action.  You cannot cast another Spell this turn.
name: Prepared Undercasting

description: You release and cast your Prepared Spell.  You cannot cast another Spell this turn.
name: Prepared Casting

description: You release and cast your Prepared Spell.
name: Prepared Mastercasting

description: As a Quick Action, you unravel a spell that you cast that has a remaining duration of at least 2 turns.  Your spell cancels and you restore 1 Mana.
name: Uncast

description: You recast the same spell that you last cast, within 1 minute.  After casting it, you restore 1 Mana.
name: Copy Cast I

description: You recast the same spell that you last cast, within 1 minutes.  After casting it, you restore 5 Mana, or the cost of the Spell, whichever is lower.
name: Copy Cast II

description: You may use your Stamina to cast a spell of up to 4 Mana, instead of spending the Mana.  You may do this even if you have no Mana remaining.
name: Burnout Cast

description: You may cast a spell without either a Verbal, or Somatic component.
name: Eschew Components

description: You may cast a spell as a Cantrip without either a Verbal, or Somatic component.
name: Eschew Cantrip Components

description: Resolve the Cast Move over 2 turns.  If you beat your target's Defences, your spell's duration is doubled.
name: Combat Ritual

description: Resolve the Cast Move and halve the required Mana.  You cast your Spell with all numeric damage, Damage Dice, and Duration halved.  If the Spell doesn't have enough numeric effects, the DM may rule to apply a penallty to your Cast a Spell Move Roll instead.
name: Weak Spell

description: When you Resolve the Cast Move with a spell that has an area of effect, you may pay 3 additional Mana.  If you do, your spell gains 1 additional sq radius of effect.
name: Reaching Spell

description: When you Resolve the Cast Move, you may pay 2 additional Mana.  If you do, your spell lasts for an additional Turn.
name: Durable Spell

description: When you Resolve the Cast Move, you may draw Verve or Mana from a willing target, or yourself, within 5sq.  For each 2 Mana or 5 Verve you draw, you gain 1 Mana towards your Spell.  Any Mana not used for your Spell is lost.
name: Willing Coterie

description: When you Resolve the Cast a Spell Move, you may attempt to draw Mana from an unwilling target that is within 5sq.  Roll the dice, even if your spell does not require it.  On a Raw Roll of 17+, you draw 1 Mana from your target.
name: Unwilling Coterie

description: As a Free Action, you may exchange any number of Mana to ignore five times the number of lost Verve from 1 source.
name: Flow Verve

description: Each time you cast a spell, you gain one Flow.  As a Free Action, you may exchange 3 Flow for 1 Mana.
name: Flow Master

description: Your Magical Synergy critical effect occurs on a Raw Roll of 19+
name: Elemental Master

description: When you cast an Energy Spell, you can choose to apply an elemental type for which you don't have Magical Synergy.  The spell costs 3 more Mana than normal and cannot achieve the Magical Synergy critical effect.
name: Elemental Shift

description: When you are the target of a magical effect that has the same type as an Elemental Effect that you have Magical Synergy with, you gain 1 Flow.  As a Free Action, you may exchange 3 Flow for 1 Mana.
name: Synergy Sink

description: When you Resolve the Cast a Spell Move for the first time in an hour, your Spell costs 1 Less Mana (to a minimum of 1, or a minimum of 0 for Cantrips).
name: Fresh Cast

description: When you Resolve the Cast a Spell Move that requires you Pierce your target's Defenses and you achieve a Raw Roll of 20, you Restore 1 Mana.
name: Critical Cast

description: When you use the Basic Melee or Ranged Attack Move against a target that is under the effect of a spell you cast, you apply an additional Verve Loss to them.
name: Spell Sink

description: When resolving a spell that grants you knowledge (such as Detect Magic), you instantly comprehend what it tells you, even in combat, without spending time.
name: Comprehending Cast

description: You leave lasting magics in items.
name: Enchanting

description: You enchant an item temporarily, or imbue your magics permanently into an item.
name: (On Hold) Enchant Item

description: You imbue a liquid with the Standard effects of a Magic Spell, up to level 2, that has the Potable Tag.  To create your concoction, you need to know the Spell Effect and have an alchemical Potion Solution prepared.  Over a number of hours equal to the Spell Effect you are creating, you must cast the spell 3 times per hour to perfect the stability of the Potion.  When you attempt this, Resolve Enchanting; if you beat the DC of the Spell Effect, you creation your potion.  If you fail, you only lose 30 minutes, and your alchemical base is not affected.  You may create one potion per day maximum.
name: Concoct Magic Potion

description: You create a Scroll that can be read and cast by a Magic User, in order to unleash the Standard effects of a Magic Spell up to level 2.  The Scroll contains shorthand magic, ready for casting at speed and in combat.  To inscribe your Spell, you need to know the Spell Effect or have a reference book to the Spell, and to transcribe the magic onto a piece of vellum or paper over a number of hours equal to the level of the Spell.  Resolve Enchanting; if you beat the DC of the Spell, you successfully transcribe a single-user Scroll of the Spell.  If you fail, you lose half the time and your paper or vellum is lost.
name: Inscribe Magic Scroll

description: You create a runic stone or symbol that can be activated by any user to unleash the Standard effects of a Magic Spell up to level 2.  To infuse the Seal, you need to know the Spell Effect and to create a Flow connection between your Source and a Seal or symbol worth 2 Standards, over a number of hours equal to half the level of the Spell.  Resolve Enchanting; if you beat the DC of the Spell, you successfully infuse the Seal and permanently increment the Infuse field on your character sheet by the Mana cost of the Spell.  If you fail, you lose half the time.  You may subtract the Infuse value on your character sheet when the Seal is used.
name: Infuse Runic Seal

description: The level of Spell effect that you can enchant with increases by 2.
name: Proficient Enchanting

description: The level of Spell effect that you can enchant with increases by 2.
name: Masterful Enchanting

description: You fully or partially transform into creatures of the forest and wilds.
name: Wildform

description:
If you beat the DC of a creature on the Wildform Creatures List, you fully transform into that creature, gaining it's physical stats, attacks and special abilities.  You may maintain the form for 1 minute per point in Wildform, or 1 round per point while in combat, per hour.

You are limited to transforming into creatures on the Wildfrom Creatures List that have DCs up to are half the number of points you've spent in Wildform.
name: Full Transformation

description: You partially transform into a creature on the Wildform Creatures List, gaining one physical stat, or one special ability.  You may maintain the form for 1 hour per point in Wildform, or 3 rounds per point while in combat, per hour.
name: Partial Transformation

description: You use a Wild Ability that you have stored.  If it must pierce Defences, resolve this with the most appropriate Move you can use.  You may store 1 Wild Ability per Strength you have.
name: Wild Ability

description: Resolve the Full Transformation or Partial Transformation Move.  You ignore the limitation of how many times you can use Wildform.
name: Lost to form

description: Resolve the Full Transformation or Partial Transformation Move.  You may choose the form of a creature up to 2 DCs higher than you can normally turn into, and the DC is only increased by 1 when you do.
name: Greater Form

description: Resolve the Full Transformation or Partial Transformation Move at half the DC of the creature you are transformed into.  If you expend 5 Verve, you maintain the form.  Each subsequent usage of this increases the Verve Cost by 5, which resets when you transform back to your regular form.
name: Push the form

description: If you have less than 10% of your HP remaining, you gain 10% of your HP when you use Wildform.
name: Adrenal Wildform

description: When using a Wildform Move in combat and you have an active Buff, you may remove the Buff and this Transformation does not count towards your limit, plus the transformation duration is doubled.
name: Buff Form

description: When using a Wildform Move and you have an active Debuff, instead of transforming, you may attempt to pass on the Debuff to a creature that you can maintain touch with for a few moments.  Resolve a Grapple Move against the target in order to see if you can touch your target.  If you succeed, your Debuff transfers to your target, for a duration equal to the remaining duration on you.
name: Rebuff

description: On a Raw Roll of 19+, add 2 to one of the numeric effects of your Wildform, or extend the duration by 2 rounds.  On a 2-, the DM can modify an aspect of the form, or cancel the form.
name: Wildform

description: Whenever you a creature is killed adjacent to you that has a Special Ability, you may use resolve Wildform Move to mimic a form of its Special Ability.  If you beat the DC of the creature, you gain 1 Wild Ability, that the DM will describe now.
name: Wild Ability Harvester

description: Whenever you use the Rest Move for at least 4 Cycles, you restore your ability to use Wildform.
name: Innate Wildform

description: If you kill a target while in Wildform, you either extend the duration by 2 rounds (if using Full Transformation), or you add another physical stat or special ability of the form youve chosen (if using Partial Transform).
name: Killform

description: You are trained in the truth of Ki.  Ki attuned may have 2 active Ki Marks per point in Ki you have purchased.
name: Ki

description: As a Quick Action, you enter the Attuned State for the remainder of the Combat, becoming able to apply Ki Marks to targets you hit, Grapple or Trip, or to yourself.  Alternatively, as a Primary Action, you resolve Ki Attunement to apply a Ki Mark to any target, or yourself, that you can perceive and which already has a Ki Mark.  You may apply a maximum of 1 Ki Mark per turn.
name: Ki Attunement

description: If you resolve a Move that brings you into contact with a target this turn, such as Basic Melee Attack, you apply a Ki Mark to them.
name: Ki Application

description: You apply a Ki Mark to yourself.
name: Ki Attunement

description: You expend a Ki Mark on yourself to resolve a Basic Melee Attack as a Critical Strike against an opponent with one of the following Statuses: Prone, Blind, Stunned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Provoked.
name: Ki Exploit

description: Until the end of your next turn, you may actively apply up to 5 Ki Marks, but no more than 2 per target including yourself.
name: Ki Torrent

description: You may expend all your Ki Marks on targets up to 10sq away, dealing 5 Magical Damage to them for each Ki Mark they have.  This damage ignores armour and magical resistances.
name: Ki Burst

description: Expend at least 2 Ki Marks on an opponent within your Threatened Area.  Resolve the Basic Melee Attack against them.  Resolve a Ki Move Roll against their Defend (WIS), gaining a +1 to your Move Roll for each Ki Mark expended.  If they fail, they gain the Stunned Status Effect.
name: Ki Pressure Points

description: You may expend Ki Marks on yourself in order to reduce the duration of a Status at a rate of 1 round per Ki Mark.
name: Ki Cleansing

description: You become hyper Attuned.  Apply a Ki Mark to yourself for each enemy you killed this turn.
name: Ki Catalyst

description: You expend all Ki Marks on yourself.  You slam a creature up to 1 size category larger than you up to 3sq per Ki Mark you used.  Creatures who hit a surface are slammed for 4 damage per square you moved them.  Resolve a Trip with no bonus against creatures that do not hit a surface.
name: Ki Force

description: You expend up to 2 Ki Marks on yourself to upgrade your Bonus Damage Dice once per Ki Mark.  Damage Bonus Dice deal either Physical, Fire, Radiant or Laceration (Wind) damage.
name: Ki Power

description: You expend 1 Ki Marks on yourself to gain 2sq of Movement this turn, and you may treat difficult terrain, water, gaseous, vertical surfaces, falling, and occupied spaces as normal spaces.
name: Ki Dash

description: When you charge directly at an opponent, expend 2 Ki Marks on yourself to ignore all terrain and other creatures as you weave between worlds to your target.  Once there, you apply 5 additional Verve Loss to any Basic Melee Attack you make this turn.
name: Ki Weave

description: You expend 2 Ki Marks on yourself.  As a Free Action you resolve the Cast a Spell Move without Mods with any spell that has the target of Self.
name: Ki Cast

description: You resolve a Basic Melee Attack with up to 3 targets who are beyond your threatening range.  The targets must each be no more than 3sq away from each other.  For each target you strike, you dash between them under the effect of the Free Move Status, and end adjacent to the final target.  Doing so costs 1 Ki Mark on yourself or them, for each target in your attack chain.
name: Ki Chain

description: You expend 1 Ki Mark to activate Ki Attunement this round and go full defensive.  When in the Ki Eye, you automatically resolve Dodge against all Standard Melee and Ranged Attacks against you, if they can be Dodged.  You also gain +2 to Rolls to Resist, Block or Dodge Special Attacks, if they can be Resisted, Blocked or Dodged.
name: Ki Eye

description: You may apply a Ki Mark to each individual creature that you successfully Blocked or Dodged last turn. You may optionally choose to apply any or all of them to yourself instead.
name: Ki Dodge

description: You expend all Ki Marks on yourself.  Gain 3 Verve per Mark expended, or may instead Restore a Stamina if you expend 6 or more Marks.
name: Ki Wellspring

description: You expend a Ki Marks on an adjacent target.  On your next turn, you gain your Bonus Damage Dice when resolving Basic Melee Attack exclusively against this creature.  Your target knows what is in store for them.
name: Ki Disruption

description: When resolving Dodge against a Ranged Attack, if you successfully Dodge and achieve a Raw Roll of 15+, you may Expend a Ki Mark on yourself or the Ranged Attacker and choose a new target for the projectile that is within 45(deg) of the flight path of the projectile.  If the projectile is dangerous to handle (for example flaming arrows), you incur the attack as well as your new target.
name: Ki Ranged Diversion

description: When resolving Basic Melee Attack against a target with 5 or more Ki Marks, you add the maximum value of your Bonus Damage Dice against them.
name: Ki Affinity

description: When Ki Attuned, you can apply Ki Marks by thrown weapons to targets within 5sq, instead of just by touch.
name: Ki Presence

description: When resolving Ki Marks on targets that have the Flanked Status, treat the creature as having one additional Ki Mark.
name: Blind Spot: Ki Point

description: When using Ki Marks on yourself, if you are under the effect of a spell, effect or Status that provides a Buff, treat the result as if you had an addition Ki Mark.
name: Ki Attuned

description: Apply a Ki Mark to yourself when you kill a creature.
name: Final Strike

description:
You have the ability to enter a Rage.  If you ever reach 0 Raging you gain the Prone Status, and you can no longer gain Rage for the remainder of the Combat.  On any turn that you do not use the Attack or Intimidate Moves, lose 3 Raging.  Whenever you deal Damage to a target, or receive Damage from any source, you gain a Raging.

If you ever reach 10 Raging you enter Unstoppable Rage, immediately gaining 3 UDR, but you may only use the Relocate and Attack Moves with no Mods, or the Rage Move and Mods or Rage Passives.  Unstoppable Rage ends when combat ends or if you run out of Raging.
name: Rage

description: You enter a Combat Rage, gaining a number of Raging equal to half of your points in Rage.
name: Rage

description: You use Rage this turn and gain 1 Raging.  You do not lose Raging this turn due to not using the Attack or Intimidate Move.
name: Raging Temper

description: You use your intimidating presence to move all opponents of the same size or smaller size categories within 5sq of you 1 square away, and gain 2 Raging.
name: Raging Glare

description: You expend 6 Raging to unnerve enemies with DC 1 or 2 within 3sq of you, reducing all of their defences by 1 until the end of your next turn.
name: Barbaric Roar

description: You expend 6 Raging to resolve Wall Slam, even if you have not purchased it.  You may additionally slam your target into another target adjacent to your target.  If you do, both creatures are damaged ths way.
name: Barbaric Slam

description: You expend 3 Raging to double your leap distance and height until the end of the turn.
name: Barbaric Leap

description: You expend 6 Raging to apply the Bleeding Status to an adjacent target.
name: Rupturing Strike

description: You expend 8 Raging to resolve a Basic Attack against up to 3 targets in a Line Shape beginning from you.  You end your turn in a free square adjacent to your last target.
name: Punch Through

description: Gain 1 Rage every time an ally takes Damage.
name: Brutal Sympathy

description: Gain 1 Rage every time you successfully Block or Dodge an attack.
name: Brutal Rebuke

description: Gain 2 Rage every time you kill a target.
name: Brutal Kill

description: You may once expend 1 Rage when resolving the Basic Mele Attack Move to apply 2 more Verve Loss, or to gain +1 to the Grapple or Trip Move.  You may use only 1 Unnatural Rage Passive per turn.
name: Unnatural Strength

description: You may once expend 1 Rage when resolving the Basic Mele Attack Move to add your Bonus Damage Dice.  You may use only 1 Unnatural Rage Passive per turn.
name: Unnatural Force

description: You may once expend 1 Rage when resolving the Basic Mele Attack Move to use the maximum value of your Bonus Damage Dice this turn.  You may use only 1 Unnatural Rage Passive per turn.
name: Unnatural Resilience

description: You may once expend 1 Rage to ignore occupied spaces of opponents up to 1 size category larger, when using Relocate.  You may move any target that you push through to an adjacent safe square.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.
name: Roaring Relocate

description: You may once expend 1 Rage to gain 3UDR against one source this turn.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.
name: Roaring Presence

description: You may once expend 1 Rage to gain +2sq of movement when resolving your Reolcate Action.  You may use only 1 Roaring Passive per turn.
name: Roaring Leap

description: You Channel the very power of the gods via your Source to bring your divine will to those around you.
name: Channel Divinity

description: While in combat, you Restore the Verve of a target by 2 Verve per point in Channel Divinity.  You may do this a number of times per day equal to half your points in Channel Divinity.
name: Lay on Hands

description: If you beat the Defence (CHA) or DC of an undead target, whichever is higher, you rebuke the undead, applying the Frightened Status to them.  You may do this a number of times per day equal to half your points in Channel Divinity.
name: Holy Word

description: If you beat a DC of 2, your target gains +1 to their next Move Roll.  You may do this a number of times per day equal to half your points in Channel Divinity.
name: Blessing

description: Resolve the Lay on Hands Move, Restoring an additional Verve per point in Channel Divinity.
name: Lay on Hands Master

description: Resolve the Lay on Hands Move, Gaining the Verve instead of Restoring it.
name: Lay on Hands Channeler

description: Resolve the Lay on Hands Move, Restoring 20% of a target's Verve.
name: Lay on Hands Diviner

description: Resolve the Holy Word Move against a beast or humanoid.
name: Holy Word Naturalist

description: Resolve the Holy Word Move against a Fae, Monster, Abberation or Demononic creature, instead of an Undead one.
name: Holy Word Planarist

description: Resolve the Holy Word Move.  If you are successful, your target gains the Terrified Status instead of Frightened.
name: Holy Word Applicant

description: Resolve the Holy Word Move.  If you are successful, instead of receiving the Frightened Status your target cannot move further than 10 sq. from you, if it can help it.
name: Ghostbuster

description: If you successfully Block or Defend against a creature, you get +2 to the Holy Word Move next turn.
name: Defensive Turn

description: If you are under the effect of a spell or effect that provides a Buff, you may add +1 to Channel Divinity Moves.
name: Attuned Channeller

description: You may hold your Channel Source until a condition arises before your next turn.  If that condition doesn't arise, you lose your Channel.
name: Delayed Channel

description: You gain +1 to the Holy Word Move against any creature you moved towards this turn, and which are within 4sq.
name: Righteous Presentation

description: Resolve the Blessing Move.  If you succeed, you apply the Blessing effect to all allied creatures in a 2x2 sq. area.
name: Blessing Glyph

description: Resolve the Blessing Move as a Quick Action.
name: Blessing Channel II

description: Once per day per point in Channel Divinity, you may apply your Bonus Damage Dice to Basic Melee or Basic Ranged Attack.  The energy type of Verve Loss applied is that which is most commonly associated with your beliefs.
name: Channeled Power

description: Something about your form, your movement, your voice, and your creations is beyond those of even the greatest creatives.  By weaving energies of your Source into your performance and creations, you can enact amazing feats of inspiration and uplifiting of the spirit.  When resolving Performance, Create Artwork, Cooking or Rhapsodic Creation, you may use the Skill of either Creativity or Rhapsody as your Roll score.
name: Rhapsody

description: You create or reveal a Rhapsodic work: a performance, a song, a scent, or even an object of art or work of wondrous cooking.  Resolve a Rhapsodic Creation and note the DC Rank you beat.  The first time a target experiences this work, they Gain 1 Verve per DC rank of your Creation starting at DC 0.  You may apply this effect to a number of targets equal to half your Rhapsody Score.  If your creation is art or food that you created earlier, you may apply this effect when you first reveal it, however you may only have 1 creation stored.  You are considered under the effect of a Rhapsodic Creation if you were the target of Rhapsodic Creation in this combat or if Rhapsodic Creation has allowed you to Gain Verve above your total which you still have.
name: Rhapsodic Creation

description: Your presence is felt in your movements, your voice and your creations, and when you focus you can control how you project this feeling.  Resolve Rhapsodic Presence and note how many DC Ranks you beat, starting at DC 0.  You gain 3 Presence for each rank you beat, and with some other passives you will be able to use them for interesting effects.
name: Rhapsodic Presence

description: You present your Rhapsodic Creation with outstanding elevation.  Your target(s) also gain the Uplifted Status.
name: Uplifting Creation

description: You present your Rhapsodic Creation with immeasurable vigour.  Your target(s) also gain the Inspired Status.
name: Inspired Creation

description: You attempt to copy part of the effect of a Spell that you could see being Cast this round.  You copy the spell with half of the numeric effects, including duration.  Treat the new spell as originating from you with the same target and shape conditions.  If the spell you copied can be Resisted, you must beat the Defences of the target using your Rhapsodic Skill with a -3 Disadvantage.
name: Go with The Flow

description: You attempt to Sympathetically copy a Positive Status effect. Resolve the Rhapsodic Creation Move, with the DC of a Spell effect or Status on a target you can see.  If you succeed, you copy the effect, including its remaining duration and other factors, to another target that you can perceive.
name: Sympathetic Creation

description: You attempt to sympathetically move a Negative Status effect. Resolve the Rhapsodic Creation Move, with the DC of a Spell effect or Status on a target you can see.  If you succeed, you move the effect, including its remaining duration and other factors, to another target that you can perceive.
name: Unsympathetic Creation

description: You grant one ally that you can see who is under the effect of a Rhapsodic Creation the ability to exchange 5 Verve to gain the Inspired Status until the start of your next turn.
name: Whistle while you work

description: You grant one ally that you can see who is under the effect of a Rhapsodic Creation the ability to exchange 15 Verve to gain the Fortified (10) Status until the start of your next turn.  You may use this a number of times equal to your CHA bonus, per combat (minimum of 1).
name: Gulliver's Symphony

description: You grant one ally that you can see who is under the effect of a Rhapsodic Creation the ability to exchange 15 Verve to gain the Hasted Status until the start of your next turn.  You may use this a number of times equal to your CHA bonus, per combat (minimum 1).
name: Rock out

description: You attempt to modify the duration of a Status on one ally.  You automatically increase the duration of a positive Status on a willing target by 1 Round.  Alternatively, you can attempt to reduce the duration of a negative Status.  Resolve Rhapsodic Creation.  If you beat half the DC, you reduce the duration of a Standard (3) Status by 1 Round.
name: Harmonious

description: If you successfully Blocked any attack last turn, Resolve Rhapsodic Creation to reset the duration of any Status applied by a Rhapsodic Creation that is in effect.  You can only use this on a Creation once.
name: Cymbal Clash

description: You attempt to rally your allies to you.  Resolve the Rhapsodic Creation Move with a DC of 1.  If you succeed, all allies who can see or hear you gain +4sq speed this turn if they move directly towards you.
name: Rally

description: You attempt to instill your allies with skill and success.  Resolve the Rhapsodic Creation Move based on a DC of 0.  If you succeed, for the rest of the turn, any allies that are within 1sq of you gain +1 to all Move Rolls.
name: Inspiring Motivator

description: You spend a Presence to have one Damage or Healing Die of yourself or an ally to automatically roll the maximum.  If you have at least 5 points in Rhapsody, this increases to 2 Damage Dice or 1 Healing Die on yourself or one ally.
name: Facilitating Presence

description: As a Free Action you may spend a Presence to roll a d20 when an enemy resolves a Basic Attack or Move.  On a Raw Roll of 20 the Move does not occur and the originator of the Move cannot replace it.  Additionally, if this was part of a multi-attack, all remaining attacks are lost.  You may only use this on each creature once per turn.
name: Discordant Presence

description: As a Free Action you may spend 1 Presence to apply Verve Loss to a creature equal to 1/2 of your points in Rhapsody.  You can apply this to each creature a maximum of once per turn.  This Verve Loss is reduced by MRes and URes.
name: Requiem Presence

description: As a Free Action you may spend 1 Presence to have an enemy that can see you switch the target of their Basic Attacks to a different target that they wish to target.  This fails if there are no other viable targets, and cannot be used on area of effect attacks or Spells.
name: Distracting Presence

description: If an ally resolves a Creativity Move to help you and beats a DC of 1, then until the end of your next turn, you gain a +1 Bonus to Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence.  This increases to a +2 Bonus if they beat a DC of 2.
name: Harmonic Chorus

description: If one of your allies has entered the Dying state this turn, the Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence Move is a Free Action this turn.
name: Noooooooo!

description: When under the effect of a negative spell, effect, or Status, you gain a +1 bonus to the Rhapsodic Creation or Rhapsodic Presence Move.
name: Tragic Artist

description: If you gain the Dying Status you automatically resolve and apply Rhapsodic Performance with either the Uplifting or Inspired Creation Mod.
name: Final Song
